08:41:46","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:41:46","title":"Arsenal transfer blow as Houssem Aouar wants Juventus transfer after Gunners offer Guendouzi plus cash","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12489264/arsenal-houssem-aouar-wants-juventus/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>ARSENAL target Houssem Aouar reportedly &#8216;only wants&#8217; Juventus this summer, in a transfer blow to the Gunners.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Mikel Arteta&#8217;s side are interested in the Lyon ace, and are even believed to be willing to offer cash-plus-<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/who/matteo-guendouzi/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Matteo Guendouzi</a> to land his signature.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489395\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000602172866-2.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489395\" width=\"960\" height=\"645\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Reuters</figcredit></figure>Houssem Aouar helped Lyon to the Champions League semi-finals[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489402\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000588443403-1.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489402\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure>Matteo Guendouzi could have been included in a deal for Aouar[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>But according to Le10 Sport, Aouar has a &#8216;clear preference&#8217; to sign for the Italian champions.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>They also reveal that <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/team/1250213/paris-saint-germain/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Paris Saint-Germain</a> and Manchester City have been monitoring the 22-year-old.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But despite possessing a plethora of options, his future would appear to lie in Turin.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>In order to afford the deal, <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/team/1362318/juventus/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Juventus</a> will have to be creative in the way it is structured.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And the report claims that they will offer a lucrative two-year loan deal with an obligation to buy at the end of it.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Aouar impressed against the Serie A champions recently, when he helped <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12345723/cristiano-ronaldo-memphis-depay-panenka-penalty-lyon-juventus/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Lyon knock the Old Lady out of the Champions League</a> in the Round of 16.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He then produced another stunning performance as he and his team-mates dumped Manchester City out at the quarter-final stage.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Despite Rudi Garcia&#8217;s side&#8217;s stunning run to the semi-finals, they will not take part in European competition next term after only coming seventh in Ligue 1.</p>\n\n\n\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n\n\n\n<h3><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/12116744/arsenal-transfer-news-live-willian-aubameyang-partey/\"><strong>ARSENAL NEWS LIVE: Click here for the latest Gunners news</strong></a></h3>\n\n\n\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n\n\n\n<p>&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And technical director Juninho has admitted that there &#8220;will be departures&#8221; from the Groupama Stadium.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He told RMC Sport: &#8220;The aim now is to continue working, immediately with Ligue 1.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;We will have to work. If we continue like this, we will be back in this competition.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;When you are well paid, you need motivation every day, we are going to concentrate on Ligue 1. There are the basics.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489408\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000527557378.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489408\" width=\"960\" +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000602172866-2.jpg?strip=all&w=960","linkMd5":"4afe78647f5b6ba93d7eaa2adde079b6","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn21@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-41-48-204_e9e0e8e4437fdc75.webp","destWidth":960,"destHeight":645,"sourceBytes":207608,"destBytes":36424,"author":"Etienne Fermie","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000602172866-2.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn21@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-41-48-204_e9e0e8e4437fdc75.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000588443403-1.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn62@2020_1/2020/08/25/00-41-59-545_0d757aa2fc2d36a1.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000527557378.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn97@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-41-59-303_feca9f0a7cb4657a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316106289},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:41:46","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:41:46","title":"One in five Americans have broken up with a partner because they weren‚Äôt ‚Äògreen‚Äô enough, study shows","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12489661/one-five-americans-broken-up-partner-werent-green/","description":"<p>One in five Americans has broken up with a partner because they weren‚Äôt ‚Äúgreen‚Äù enough, according to new research.</p>\n<p>The survey of 2,000 Americans looked at the intersection of dating and being environmentally friendly, and revealed 56% think it‚Äôs a turn-off when a potential partner isn‚Äôt eco-friendly.</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12489659\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603900362.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489659\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure>56% of Americans think it‚Äôs a turn-off when a potential partner isn‚Äôt eco-friendly[/caption]</p>\n<p>Not everyone will take such extreme action as breaking things off, but results revealed respondents do value a partner who cares about the environment.</p>\n<p>Sixty-nine percent of those surveyed said they find being environmentally friendly an attractive trait in a partner.</p>\n<p>Conducted by OnePoll on behalf of&#160;<a href=\"https://www.avocadogreenmattress.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Avocado Green Mattress</a>, the survey found this is one of many things respondents like to have in common with their partner.</p>\n<p>The old adage ‚Äúopposites attract‚Äù might not be true after all, as 84% believe it‚Äôs important for them and their partner to have similar values.</p>\n<p>Top of the list for things respondents want to have in common with their partner was future/long-term plans, followed by having shared values and a complementary sense of humor.</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12489660\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603900394.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489660\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure>84% believe it‚Äôs important for them and their partner to have similar values[/caption]</p>\n<p>Half of Americans surveyed felt it was important to have a similar attitude toward sex, while 49% want themself and their partner to have a similar lifestyle, whether that‚Äôs being a homebody or going out in the evenings.</p>\n<p>A third believe it‚Äôs important to share political opinions, while 27% want to have similar levels of political actions.</p>\n<p>And part of their political actions is how environmentally friendly they are: results revealed 53% believe a desire to protect the planet is sexy ‚Äî and 55% said it would be a dealbreaker if a potential partner believed climate change was a hoax.</p>\n<p>‚ÄúListening is fundamental to any partnership,‚Äù said Avocado Mattress cofounder and CMO Mark Abrials. ‚ÄúNot hearing the very real threats of climate change or dismissing our individual responsibility on this planet jeopardizes more than our relationships. It puts us all at greater risk.‚Äù</p>\n<p>While some respondents value a partner who is eco-friendly, others have become more environmentally friendly after being in a relationship.</p>\n<p>\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col sun-col-6\">\n\n\t\t\t<div their hips and butts at the end.&#160;</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/entertainment/1345580/dog-bounty-hunter-jamie-troll-fitness/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Jamie</a> said the clip &#8211; which was taken in front of the gorgeous water &#8211; was part of the ‚ÄúBest Friend Dance Challenge.‚Äù</p>\n<p>The best friend duo also took part in the Roll Call dance which consists of a group lined up while busting out a move as they approach the camera one-by-one.&#160;</p>\n<p>Just before their family dance, Jamie and Zach recreated a comedy bit about imagination</a> in a teeny black bikini.¬†</p>\n<p>The dog mom‚Äôs low-cut bikini top was paired with matching thong bottoms that showed off the star‚Äôs curves.&#160;</p>\n<p>She wore the suit during "https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn73@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-41-57-326_6ae7e5c716fab23c.webp","https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000591435515-2.png?strip=all&w=609":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn15@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-42-02-838_97bd24320a861fd9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316106185},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:41:46","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:41:46","title":"White supremacist Richard Spencer who popularized term ‚Äòalt-right‚Äô says he‚Äôs voting for Joe Biden","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12489183/white-supremacist-richard-spencer-voting-for-joe-biden/","description":"<p><strong>WHITE supremacist Richard Spencer, who popularized the term &#8220;alt-right,&#8221; has said he is voting for Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden. </strong></p>\n<p>Spencer announced his shift in political stance over the weekend through a series of tweets and a self-made campaign slogan that read: &#8220;Liberals are clearly more competent.&#8221;</p>\n<p><strong><strong><img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/26a0.png\" alt=\"‚ö†\" class=\"wp-smiley\" style=\"height: 1em; max-height: 1em;\" /></strong></strong> <strong>Follow our<a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/news/1186278/us-election-2020-trump-biden-latest-news/\"> US election 2020 live blog </a>for the latest news &#38; updates</strong> </p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12489178\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000591447920.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489178\" width=\"960\" height=\"668\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>AP:Associated Press</figcredit></figure>White supremacist Richard Spencer was one of the key figureheads of the alt-right movement[/caption]</p>\n<p>&#8220;I plan to vote for <a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/who/joe-biden/\">Biden</a> and a straight democratic ticket. It‚Äôs not based on &#8216;accelerationism&#8217; or anything like that; the liberals are clearly more competent people,&#8221; Spencer wrote on <a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/topic/twitter/\">Twitter</a> on Sunday. </p>\n<p>Spencer, who backed <a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/who/donald-trump/\">President Donald Trump</a> in 2016, further said that &#8220;the MAGA/Alt-Right moment is over&#8221;</p>\n<p>His tweet read: &#8220;The MAGA/Alt-Right moment is over. I made mistakes; Trump is an obvious disaster; but mainly the paradigm contained flaws that we now are able to perceive.</p>\n<p>&#8220;And it needs to end. So be patient. We&#8217;ll have another day in the sun. We need to recover and return in a new form.</p>\n<p>&#8220;Voting for Trump is arguably the more &#8216;accelerationist&#8217; choice,&#8221; Spencer said, referring to a radical white supremacist ideology called accelerationism.</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12489179\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 750px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603878445.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=740\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489179\" width=\"740\" height=\"288\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Twitter</figcredit></figure>White supremacist Richard Spencer shared on Twitter that he is voting for Joe Biden[/caption]</p>\n<p>Accelerationism rests on the idea that Western governments are irreparably corrupt. As a result, the best thing white supremacists can do is accelerate their demise by sowing chaos and creating political tension, according to <a href=\"https://www.vox.com/the-highlight/2019/11/11/20882005/accelerationism-white-supremacy-christchurch\">Vox</a>.</p>\n<p>He continued by giving examples of accelerationism: &#8220;Under [Trump&#8217;s] watch cities are collapsing, we almost started World War III, the attacks on people like me increased 10 fold, etc. The <a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/topic/democratic-party/\">Democrats</a> simply more competent managers of decline.&#8221;</p>\n<div class=\"oembed-container oembed-twitter\">\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-width=\"550\" data-dnt=\"true\">\n<p lang=\"en\" dir=\"ltr\">The MAGA/Alt-Right moment is over. I made mistakes; Trump is an obvious disaster; but mainly the paradigm contained flaws that we now are able to perceive. And it needs to end. So be patient. We&#39;ll have another day in the sun. We need to recover and return in a new form.</p>\n<p>&#8212; Richard <img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/1f981.png\" alt=\"ü¶Å\" class=\"wp-smiley\" style=\"height: 1em; max-height: 1em;\" /> Spencer (@RichardBSpencer) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/RichardBSpencer/status/1297785982515732480?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">August 24, 2020</a></p></blockquote>\n<p><script async src=\"https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script></div>\n<p>In a follow-up Twitter post early Monday morning, Spencer shared an image of himself with the words: &#8220;I&#8217;m on team Joe.&#8221;</p>\n<p>His self-made slogan also took a jab at conservatives and other political groups and it read: &#8220;Liberals are clearly more competent.&#8221;</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12489180\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 861px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603890616.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=851\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489180\" width=\"851\" height=\"480\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Twitter</figcredit></figure>Spencer tweeted a photo of himself and said that he is on team Joe[/caption]</p>\n<p>But Spencer&#8217;s endorsement was swiftly rejected by a spokesperson for the <a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/who/joe-biden/\">Biden campaign</a>.</p>\n<p>&#8220;When Joe Biden says we are in a battle for the soul of our nation against vile forces of hate who have come crawling out from under rocks, you are the epitome of what he means. What you stand for is absolutely repugnant. Your support is 10,000% percent unwelcome here,&#8221; Andrew Bates, the campaign&#8217;s director of rapid response, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/AndrewBatesNC/status/1297739715056144385?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1297739715056144385%7Ctwgr%5E&#38;ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newsweek.com%2Fbiden-campaign-rejects-richard-spencer-endorsement-condemns-views-absolutely-repugnant-1527230\">tweeted</a>.</p>\n<p>Spencer first rose to fame in 2016 when he ended his speech by quoting <a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/topic/nazis/\">Nazi</a> propaganda in German and shouted &#8220;Hail Trump! Hail our people! Hail victory!&#8221; as audience members responded by making the Nazi salute.</p>\n<p>He said that whites are &#8220;a race that travels forever on an upward path,&#8221; adding that &#8220;to be white is to be a creator, an explorer, a conqueror.&#8221;</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12489181\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603878984.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489181\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure>Spencer and his supporters clashed with Virginia State Police after the Unite the Right rally was declared an unlawful gathering  in 2017[/caption]</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12489182\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/46d0598f-fd24-4e5f-87b0-68607ae08e51.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489182\" width=\"960\" height=\"630\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty - Contributor</figcredit></figure>The Unite the Right march was called to protest against plans to remove a statue of a general who had fought for the pro-slavery Confederacy during the Civil War[/caption]</p>\n<p>What&#8217;s more, on the eve of the 2017 Unite the Right rally in Charlottesville, Virginia, Spencer and others marched through the University of Virginia‚Äôs campus and shouted racist and anti-Semitic slogans.</p>\n<p>Things escalated when street brawls erupted between white nationalists planning to attend the march and counter-protesters, resulting in one death and over a dozen injured.</p>\n<p>But Spencer shifted his stance earlier this year after the killing of Iranian general&#160;<a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/who/qasem-soleimani/\">Qasem&#160;Soleimani</a>.</p>\n<p>Spencer feared that Trump&#8217;s approved airstrike which resulted in the death of&#160;Soleimani&#160;brought the US to the brink of war with Iran.</p>\n<p>&#8220;I deeply regret voting for and promoting Donald Trump in 2016,&#8221; Spencer <a href=\"https://twitter.com/RichardBSpencer/status/1214707279015972864\">tweeted</a> on January 7. &#8220;To the people of Iran, there are millions of Americans who do not want war, who do not hate you, and who respect your nation and its history.&#8221;</p>\n<p>\t\t<!-- Start of Brightcove Player -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div style=\"display: block; position: relative; min-width: 0px; max-width: -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t</p>\n<p>In June, Spencer was one of many <a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/news/1058417/youtube-bans-white-supremacists-richard-spencer-david-duke/\">white supremacists who were banned from using YouTube because of hate speech</a>.</p>\n<p>YouTube policy disallows videos &#8220;alleging that a group is superior in order to justify discrimination,&#8221; and six channels in total were found to break those rules.</p>\n<p>On the same day, Twitch temporarily banned Trump&#8217;s channel for breaking its hateful content policy, and Reddit shut down a forum for supporters of the president.</p>\n<div></div>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 20:28:02 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/26a0.png","linkMd5":"6cb65785da26671549c00e579a83bcbc","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn13@2020_1/2020/08/25/00-41-46-615_8c2ee998bba5b6ed.webp","destWidth":72,"destHeight":72,"sourceBytes":595,"destBytes":1080,"author":"janine.phakdeetham@the-sun.com","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/26a0.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn13@2020_1/2020/08/25/00-41-46-615_8c2ee998bba5b6ed.webp","https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000591447920.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn100@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-42-03-649_b9384ea7c2900a11.webp","https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603878445.jpg?strip=all&w=740":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn20@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-42-00-968_2c923e9fa80c4b1f.webp","https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/1f981.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn40@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-42-02-088_dacaf9f6b6ce5eb6.webp","https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603890616.jpg?strip=all&w=851":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn85@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-41-55-938_0e53fc7ca3c3d23f.webp","https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603878984.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn10@2020_1/2020/08/25/00-41-50-851_5e1fab04eab779a4.webp","https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/46d0598f-fd24-4e5f-87b0-68607ae08e51.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn10@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-41-56-738_485f6fa16ef4b5f6.webp","https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603191221.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn95@2020_1/2020/08/25/00-42-05-201_4c5d95c9c837055f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316106296},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:41:46","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:41:46","title":"Much loved 90s sketch show The Fast Show returns with ALL its catchphrases","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tv/12488707/the-fast-show-returns-catchphrases/","description":"<p><strong>IT was the sketch show that spawned a thousand catchphrases, from ‚ÄúSuits you, sir‚Äù to ‚ÄúNo offence!‚Äù.</strong></p> \n<p>The cast of The Fast Show have reunited to celebrate its 26th anniversary, with a new two-parter which includes interviews and new sketches featuring favourite characters as talking heads, looking back on the original show.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12489581\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/tp-graphic-fast-show-returns-new.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489581\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">\n  The much loved 90s sketch show The Fast Show is returning with ALL its catchphrases\n </figcaption>\n <figcredit></figcredit>\n</figure> \n<p>We talk to Fast Show stalwarts Charlie Higson, Paul Whitehouse, John Thomson, Arabella Weir, Simon Day and Mark Williams.</p> \n<h3><strong>WHAT WERE YOU DOING BEFORE THE FAST SHOW?</strong></h3> \n<p><strong>Higson: </strong>Paul and I were friends with Harry Enfield and Vic Reeves and while we were in the decorating world, we fell into comedy and did some writing for their shows.</p> \n<p><strong>Day:</strong> I was doing gardening and labouring, then I started stand-up. I had problems with addiction and fruit machines so I spent a lot of time in pubs with ne‚Äôer-do-wells but I found them fascinating.</p> \n<p>I didn‚Äôt know why I was watching these people but it turned out perfect because it all fed what I ended up doing. You have to live a life before you do comedy.</p> \n<p><strong>Thomson:</strong> I was doing character stand-up when they approached me. As an actor, what better platform is there for all your skill sets? I‚Äôd rather do a sketch show than any movie. It‚Äôs so nice to open up the dressing-up box and get the wigs on.</p> \n<p><strong>Weir:</strong> I‚Äôd acted on shows with Harry Enfield, Alexei Sayle and Lenny Henry. It would often say on the script, ‚ÄòWoman in sketch‚Äô or ‚ÄòMum‚Äô, so I didn‚Äôt feel like one of the gang for the first series.</p> \n<p>John, Caroline and Simon had done stand-up and I hadn‚Äôt, and Mark was very sure of himself. I had impostor syndrome.</p> \n<p><strong>Williams:</strong> I‚Äôd done Harry Enfield so I knew Paul and Charlie. Before that I‚Äôd been in the Royal Shakespeare Company.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12488897\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000249124328.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12488897\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  PA:Press Association\n </figcredit>\n</figure>The cast in 1997 with Caroline seated, second from right[/caption] \n<h3><strong>HOW DID THE IDEA COME ABOUT?</strong></h3> \n<p><strong>Higson: </strong>We wanted to have our own show but we weren‚Äôt sure how to make it different enough from Harry‚Äôs.</p> \n<p>Then we saw a highlights reel that Harry‚Äôs producer Geoffrey Perkins had made for the press and we thought, ‚ÄòWhy don‚Äôt we make a whole show like this? Get the characters on, cut it right to the bone and just show the funny bits‚Äô.</p> \n<p><strong>Whitehouse: </strong>We pretty much kept to that, although ironically the most popular characters were Ted and Ralph, which were quite long, slow sketches with no catchphrases.</p> \n<p><strong>Williams: </strong>I was very enthusiastic about the idea. I thought the sketch show was looking a bit stretched but I‚Äôd been brought up on Monty Python and Spike Milligan so I loved the idea of freshening it up.</p> \n<p><strong>Day: </strong>At the time, a lot of TV sketches were written by Cambridge types and they took the mickey out of politicians and we were the first ones who really did normal life.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12488896\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000093661158.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12488896\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  BBC\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Charlie as smoothie car salesman Toni in the 90s[/caption] \n<h3><strong>YOU ALL WROTE SKETCHES. HOW MUCH OF A TEAM EFFORT WAS IT?</strong></h3> \n<p><strong>Day: </strong>It‚Äôs like putting together a football team. You‚Äôve got to make sure it‚Äôs well balanced and not just 11 Messis or Ronaldos. Mark did the very quick ones, whereas my stuff was much more wordy.</p> \n<p><strong>Williams:</strong> We all wrote, and Paul and Charlie would referee who got to act in them. But we all wanted to be them all. We all wanted to be Ted and Ralph in particular. It was like trying to get yourself picked for the football team.</p> \n<p><strong>Weir:</strong> It‚Äôs like the old rock and roll thing ‚Äî you might not have written Jumpin‚Äô Jack Flash if you hadn‚Äôt all been in the room. Paul and Charlie had worked with other people and been the also-rans and they thought, ‚ÄòWe‚Äôre not going to do that to someone else‚Äô.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12488891\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000089236490-1.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12488891\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  BBC\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Paul and Charlie as Ted and Ralph[/caption] \n<h3>WHEN DID YOU REALISE HOW BIG IT HAD BECOME?</h3> \n<p><strong>Thomson:</strong> It was a grower. It‚Äôs edgy and a bit cult. Quite a few bands loved The Fast Show because it was the go-to tour bus DVD.</p> \n<p>I was in the Groucho Club with Shaun Ryder and Bez (from the Happy Mondays) and the manager came up and I was told Johnny Depp wanted to meet me. I stayed up until 4am talking to him.</p> \n<p><strong>Whitehouse:</strong> A lot of musicians liked The Fast Show because they were always off their nuts after a gig and didn‚Äôt realise it was pretty much the same sketch every week.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12488893\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 650px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000093700900.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=640\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12488893\" width=\"640\" height=\"960\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Handout\n </figcredit>\n</figure>The Jazz Club guy is played by John Thomson[/caption] \n<h3>DID YOU HAVE ANY TREPIDATION ABOUT MAKING NEW SKETCHES FOR THE REUNION SHOW?</h3> \n<p><strong>Higson: </strong>We‚Äôve always tried to keep as high a quality control as possible, which is how we‚Äôve ended up making less money than people who just bash them out!</p> \n<p><strong>Weir: </strong>I don‚Äôt want to pay ¬£200 to see Madonna and see an old woman with a Zimmer frame, I want to see her deliver. So of course you approach this with some trepidation. The Fast Show is the genesis of us all going up a level in our careers so if we just went, ‚ÄòSure, let‚Äôs phone it in for a few quid‚Äô, it would be like treating your first-born badly.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12488894\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 694px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000435506537.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=684\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12488894\" width=\"684\" height=\"960\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  PA:Press Association\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Comedians Paul Whitehouse and Charlie Higson also star in the show[/caption] \n<h3>WERE THERE ANY CHARACTERS YOU LEFT OUT BECAUSE THEY HAVEN‚ÄôT AGED WELL?</h3> \n<p><strong>Higson:</strong> Ted and Ralph. We did think about doing something where maybe Ted had died, but then we thought, ‚ÄòNo, let‚Äôs just leave it there as a good memory rather than trample all over that‚Äô. In my mind they are still there, not managing to talk to each other. Their relationship can never be and will never be resolved.</p> \n<p><strong>Day: </strong>I don‚Äôt really do Dave Angel these days because global warming isn‚Äôt funny any more. But bringing Greta Thunberg into it was an obvious way of doing it.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12488888\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 762px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000000045863.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=752\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12488888\" width=\"752\" height=\"960\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  BBC\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Paul Whitehouse‚Äôs Fast Show creation Ron Manager[/caption] \n<h3>WHICH IS YOUR MOST POPULAR CHARACTER?</h3> \n<p><strong>Higson: </strong>Swiss Toni. People are always saying things are like making love to a beautiful woman. And actually the depressed artist too.</p> \n<p><strong>Day: </strong>Dave Angel ‚Äî people love his walk. And Competitive Dad. So many dads come up to me. I didn‚Äôt know at the time he would be so popular.</p> \n<p><strong>Thomson:</strong> Jazz Club guy. People still say ‚ÄòNice‚Äô to me all the time. People think the catchphrase is ‚ÄòJazz‚Äô but I never say that! It‚Äôs ‚ÄòNice‚Äô or ‚ÄòGreat‚Äô.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12488886\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 714px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000000038657.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=704\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12488886\" width=\"704\" height=\"960\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  BBC\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Mark Williams says he has always been very enthusiastic about the show[/caption] \n<h3>DID YOU EVER MEET THE REAL-LIFE PEOPLE WHO INSPIRED SOME OF YOUR SKETCHES?</h3> \n<p><strong>Day: </strong>I know someone who met (comedian and EastEnders star) Mike Reid and did a Dave Angel impression and apparently he went, ‚ÄòOi, we don‚Äôt talk about that around here‚Äô. If I‚Äôd met him I‚Äôd have been terrified.</p> \n<p>The witch doctor was based on Jay Kay from Jamiroquai. I‚Äôve heard members of the band thought it was very funny but Jay Kay wasn‚Äôt keen. I think he was probably a bit starry.</p> \n<p><strong>Whitehouse: </strong>Not The Fast Show, but there were one or two DJs who didn‚Äôt like Smashy and Nicey that me and Harry used to do. Dave Lee Travis didn‚Äôt like it. He did some tirade about how c**p they were.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12488887\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000001306280.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12488887\" width=\"960\" height=\"824\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  BBC\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Paul Whitehouse as ‚ÄòBrilliant‚Äô in The Fast Show[/caption] \n<h2>WHAT ARE YOUR MEMORIES OF THE FAST SHOW‚ÄôS LIVE TOUR?</h2> \n<p><strong>Higson: </strong>We did a 32-night residency with Shooting Stars at the Hammersmith Apollo, then a tour of stadiums.</p> \n<p>It was like a major rock tour with three huge lorries, a coach, a make-up team and supporting artists. Our promotor had Peter Kay on tour at the same time and that was just him and a sound man in a car with a microphone. Who do you think made more money? But it was huge fun.</p> \n<p><strong>Weir: </strong>It was a bit too ‚Äòlads on tour‚Äô because they were in nightclubs ‚Äôtil 3am whereas I was driving 250 miles back home every night so I could be there for the children in the morning.</p> \n<p>It was very punishing with young children but nothing comes close to the feeling when you walk out on stage and before you‚Äôve said anything, 4,000 people start cheering.</p> \n<!--googleoff: all--> \n<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\"> \n <div class=\"sun-row \"> \n  <div class=\"col sun-col-6\"> \n   <div class=\"rail Kids' Danny Jones bursts into tears when he has to send 2 stars home </span> \n       </div>\n       <!-- .rail__item-content --> \n       <div class=\"rail__item-gradient-light\"> \n       </div> \n Just A Load Of Blooming Catchphrases airs this Saturday[/caption] \n<h3><strong>WOULD YOU LIKE TO BRING THE CHARACTERS BACK AGAIN OR IS THIS IT?</strong></h3> \n<p><strong>Thomson:</strong> I think a Fast Show panto would be brilliant. I‚Äôve got ideas for new sketches.</p> \n<p><strong>Weir: </strong>We‚Äôd all love to do a live show. We‚Äôd have to do it before we turn into the Rolling Stones, though.</p> \n<p><strong>Higson: </strong>Paul and I have been talking about putting the team together again for a TV film or something, with new characters. That would be more exciting than once again getting the wigs out of storage.</p> \n<ul>\n <li><strong>The Fast Show: Just A Load Of Blooming Catchphrases airs at 9pm this Saturday on Gold.</strong></li>\n</ul> \n<div class=\"article-boxout\"> \n <div class=\"article-boxout__header theme__background-color\"> \n  <h3 class=\"article-boxout__headline\">WE SO MISS‚Ää‚ÄäGENIUS PAL CAROLINE</h3> \n </div> \n <div class=\"article-boxout__content theme__background-color-rgba-20\"> \n  <div> \n   <p><strong>WHAT are your memories of co-star Caroline Aherne, who died four years ago?</strong></p> \n   <p>Thomson: She was very talented. She used to play ditzy but she was so sharp.<br />She was sorely missed at the reunion but we filmed it separately over two days so in that sense her absence wasn‚Äôt as noticeable.</p> \n   <p><strong>Day: </strong>I never really saw Caroline towards the end because she became a massive star with The Royle Family.<br />She was amazing, especially because it was harder to do it as a woman in that time, which was all FHM and Loaded.<br />She was a proper comic genius. Off-stage she‚Äôd be hysterically funny and make the rest of us look stupid.</p> \n  </div> \n </div> \n</div> \n<!-- Start of Brightcove Player --> \n<div style=\"display: block; position: relative; min-width: 0px; max-width: 640px;\"> \n <div style=\"padding-top: 56%; \"> \n  <video data-video-id=\"5571059786001\" data-account=\"5067014667001\" data-player=\"default\" data-usage=\"cms:wordpress:5.4.2:1.7.0:javascript\" data-embed=\"default\" class=\"video-js\" controls=\"\" style=\"width: 100%; height: 100%; position: absolute; top: 0; bottom: 0; right: 0; left: 0;\"> \n  </video> \n  <script src=\"https://players.brightcove.net/5067014667001/default_default/index.min.js\"></script> \n </div> \n</div> \n<!-- End of Brightcove Player --> \n<p><strong>GOT a story? 00-42-02-926_a7ec44fe4c4176ec.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316106188},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:41:46","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:41:46","title":"Jerry Falwell Jr says wife had affair with pool boy, 20, ‚Äòwho is trying to extort them‚Äô as he quits Liberty University","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12490271/jerry-falwell-jr-sex-affair-wife-liberty-university-giancarlo-granda/","description":"<p>JERRY Falwell Jr has resigned as the president of Liberty University after claiming a former pool boy has been extorting him over an affair the man had with Falwell Jr&#8217;s wife.</p>\n<p>Hours after a scathing report detailed the <a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/news/1360012/jerry-falwell-jr-becki-tilley-giancarlo-granda-affair/\">story of Giancarlo Granda</a>, a former pool boy-turned-business partner of Falwell who claims he engaged a in sexual relationship with Falwell Jr&#8217;s wife after they met at a Miami Beach hotel when he was 20, Falwell Jr is pushing back and saying the pool boy has attempted to extort the couple.</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12490265\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 763px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603904214.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=753\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12490265\" width=\"753\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Jerry Falwell Jr says his wife Becki had been involved in a sexual relationship &#8211; but he maintains he was not involved</figcaption><figcredit>Reuters</figcredit></figure></p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12490266\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603904101.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12490266\" width=\"960\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Instead Falwell Jr says Granda tried to extort him and his wife</figcaption><figcredit>Instagram</figcredit></figure></p>\n<p>&#8220;We have categorically rejected this person‚Äôs demands while dealing with him and this particular member of the media who seemed just as obsessed with the prurient, untrue aspects of this story, however fantastic,&#8221; he wrote in a statement he sent to the <a href=\"https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/washington-secrets/exclusive-falwell-says-fatal-attraction-threat-led-to-depression\">Washington Examiner</a>.</p>\n<p>&#8220;It was like living on a roller coaster,&#8221; Falwell Jr said of the tumultuous years while he dealt with Granda&#8217;s threats to come public about the affair. </p>\n<p>&#8220;While completely dedicating ourselves to Liberty, we were also suffering in silence during our personal time together, while simultaneously trying to manage and deal with this increasingly threatening behavior, which only worsened over time.&#8221;</p>\n<p>&#8220;We were doing our best to respectfully unravel this ‚Äòfatal attraction‚Äô type situation to protect our family and the University,&#8221; he wrote, describing the situation after the 1987 film.</p>\n<p>Granda claims he began a sexual relationship with Falwell&#8217;s wife when he was just 20 &#8211; and the relationship continued for several years after. </p>\n<p>He alleges he would have sex with Falwell&#8217;s wife while the Christian conservative figurehead watched.</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12490267\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 640px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603905536.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=630\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12490267\" width=\"630\" height=\"866\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Falwell Jr recently was in public light for posting this onto Instagram before quickly deleting it</figcaption><figcredit>Instagram</figcredit></figure></p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12490268\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000600390332-1.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12490268\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Falwell Jr has also resigned from his position as president of Liberty University</figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure></p>\n<p>&#8220;Becki and I developed an intimate relationship and Jerry enjoyed watching from the corner of the room,‚Äù the now-29-year-old Granda said while detailing sexual encounters at Miami and New York hotels as well as at the Falwell&#8217;s home in Virginia that occurred &#8220;multiple times per year.&#8221;</p>\n<p>Granda backed his claims with emails, text messages and other evidence.</p>\n<p>Falwell Jr says the claims are nothing substantive. </p>\n<p>In his statement, he wrote: &#8220;Becki had an inappropriate personal relationship with this person, something in which I was not involved.&#8221; Falwell Jr then wrote his version of the account.</p>\n<p>&#8220;During a vacation over eight years ago, Becki and I met an ambitious young man who was working at our hotel and was saving up his money to go to school. </p>\n<p>&#8220;We encouraged him to pursue an education and a career and we were impressed by his initiative in suggesting a local real estate opportunity,&#8221; Falwall Jr wrote. </p>\n<p>&#8220;My family members eventually made an investment in a local property, included him in the deal because he could play an active role in managing it, and became close with him and his family.&#8221;</p>\n<p>Between biblical quotes and expressing love and forgiveness for his wife, Falwell Jr then details how Granda attempted to take advantage of the affair.</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12490269\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/fe10b096-1f23-4bbb-b3bd-80216fe8fb49.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12490269\" width=\"960\" height=\"777\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">The resigning president believes Granda may have targeted other high profile women</figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure></p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12490270\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 827px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603904358.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=817\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12490270\" width=\"817\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Falwell Jr said he forgave his wife and they are using the time to reflect</figcaption><figcredit>Instagram</figcredit></figure></p>\n<p>&#8220;While we tried to distance ourselves from him over time, he unfortunately became increasingly angry and aggressive,&#8221; Falwell Jr wrote. </p>\n<p>&#8220;Eventually, he began threatening to publicly reveal this secret relationship with Becki and to deliberately embarrass my wife, family, and Liberty University unless we agreed to pay him substantial monies.</p>\n<p>&#8220;While this was very upsetting, we had been advised by trusted legal counsel that it was best to maintain contact with this person, as we tried to manage his increasingly erratic behavior and unreasonable demands while extricating ourselves from him both on a personal level and from that real estate transaction,&#8221; he wrote, saying he had met Granda&#8217;s family and believes Granda &#8220;may have targeted other successful women.&#8221;</p>\n<p>&#8220;Even years after the improper relationship had ended, this person continued to be aggressive with Becki and me in a variety of ways. </p>\n<p>&#8220;We finally decided that we had to further withdraw completely from him, which resulted in him stepping up his threats to share more outrageous and fabricate claims about us,&#8221; while referring to a 2018 incident the two had when <a href=\"https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/aramroston/jerry-falwell-jr-michael-cohen-pool-attendant-lawsuit\">they launched a business togethe</a>r, only for Trump&#8217;s fixer Michael Cohen to get involved when Granda claimed he had been wrongly cut out.</p>\n<p>&#8220;Over the course of the last few months this person&#8217;s behavior has reached a level that we have decided the only way to stop this predatory behavior is to go public,&#8221; he concluded.&#8221;</p>\n<p>One of Trump‚Äôs most well-known evangelical supporters, Falwell Jr&#8217;s father Jerry Falwell founded Liberty University over 50 years ago, turning it from a small Baptist college into an institution with a close to $2 billion endowment.</p>\n<p>\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t</p>\n<p>Falwell Jr <a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/news/1274719/jerry-falwell-jr-indefinite-leave-liberty-university/\">resigned on Monday</a> from his role as president of Liberty University amid the sex scandal.</p>\n<p>&#8220;My commitment to Liberty became and has remained my primary focus ‚Äî and while I am so grateful and thankful for our collective successes, I also realize in hindsight that there was a toll that this took on me,&#8221; Falwell Jr wrote. </p>\n<p>&#8220;My wife Becki and I agreed that this was the right time for me to share more of our story, because the Liberty community deserves to hear it directly from me and from us.&#8221;</p>\n<div></div>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 23:52:58 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603904214.jpg?strip=all&w=753","linkMd5":"1a6adf34128863c073610d8e2de7b308","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn5@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-41-47-584_462c3d9490282aa4.webp","destWidth":753,"destHeight":960,"sourceBytes":210598,"destBytes":210598,"author":"Catherina Gioino","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603904214.jpg?strip=all&w=753":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn5@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-41-47-584_462c3d9490282aa4.webp","https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603904101.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn62@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-41-59-259_9cf9917a0e68d4c9.webp","https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603905536.jpg?strip=all&w=630":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn78@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-41-50-781_eaf2e37f5bac9ea9.webp","https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000600390332-1.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn39@2020_1/2020/08/25/00-42-01-230_48ec9fa81aae21aa.webp","https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/fe10b096-1f23-4bbb-b3bd-80216fe8fb49.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn21@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-41-56-921_1350335b555277f4.webp","https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603904358.jpg?strip=all&w=817":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn37@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-41-51-200_6f8fa335c5378133.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316106179},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:41:46","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:41:46","title":"Schools kids could avoid detention because of Covid-19 safety rules","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12489688/schools-kids-avoid-detention-covid-19/","description":"<p><strong>KIDS could avoid detention because of Covid safety rules.</strong></p> \n<p>But parents risk getting more than a slap on the wrist by being fined if they refuse to send their children <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/topic/schools-reopening/\">back to school</a>.</p> \n<p><strong><img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/26a0.png\" alt=\"‚ö†\" class=\"wp-smiley\" style=\"height: 1em; max-height: 1em;\" /> Read our <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12383728/coronavirus-uk-news-deaths-live-latest-schools/\">coronavirus live blog</a> for the latest news &amp; updates</strong></p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12489758\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603882783.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489758\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Alamy\n </figcredit>\n</figure>School children could avoid detention due to the Covid-19 safety rules[/caption] \n<figure id=\"attachment_12489847\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 748px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000602663558-2.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=738\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489847\" width=\"738\" height=\"960\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  PA:Press Association\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Education Secretary Gavin Williamson says fining parents would be a last resort[/caption] \n<p>Ministers are gearing up their campaign to get all pupils back to the classroom full time next week.</p> \n<p>But many schools may not be able to have detention or isolation rooms for misbehaving students because it would mix year groups.</p> \n<p>One teacher said: ‚ÄúThe message coming down from superiors is that, for some children, going back to school will be hard.</p> \n<p>‚ÄúThis could have a knock-on effect on behaviour. Therefore, where possible, teachers need to show leniency. <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12481099/ditch-social-distancing-second-major-wave-coronavirus/\">Social distancing </a>rules also mean the idea of putting a child and teacher on their own for an hour in detention after school is a non-starter.</p> \n<p>‚ÄúIt is one change pupils will be cheering about ‚Äî but it may leave teachers pulling their hair out.‚Äù</p> \n<h2>STRICT ORDERS</h2> \n<p>Schools in England are under strict orders to put secondary school years into ‚Äúbubbles‚Äù and not allow them to mingle with each other to reduce any risk of the spread of the virus.</p> \n<p>But ministers are taking a tougher tone with parents. They insisted school will again be ‚Äúcompulsory‚Äù from next week ‚Äî and parents who refuse to send kids back face ¬£60 fines.</p> \n<p>Education Secretary <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/who/gavin-williamson/\">Gavin Williamson</a> said: ‚ÄúIn terms of fining, we would ask all schools to work with those parents to encourage them to bring their children back and deal with any concerns they may have.</p> \n<p>‚ÄúFining would be very much the last resort ‚Äî as it has always been.‚Äù</p> \n<p>He also said schools would be placed in local lockdown again only as a final course of action.</p> \n<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/ac-graphic-UK-deaths-per-day-linegraph-24-AUG-1.jpg\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/ac-graphic-UK-deaths-per-day-linegraph-24-AUG-1.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-large wp-image-12486897\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /></a> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/ac-graphic-UK-cases-per-day-linegraph-24-AUG-2.jpg\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/ac-graphic-UK-cases-per-day-linegraph-24-AUG-2.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-large wp-image-12486970\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /></a> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<div class=\"article-boxout\"> \n <div class=\"article-boxout__header theme__background-color\"> \n  <h3 class=\"article-boxout__headline\">The Sun Says </h3> \n </div> \n <div class=\"article-boxout__content theme__background-color-rgba-20\"> \n  <p class=\"article__content--intro\"> NO ONE relishes nervous parents being punished for keeping kids off school. But if that is the impetus they need as a last resort to conquer their Covid fear, so be it. </p> \n  <div> \n   <p>Normal sanctions must apply once schools go back, as even Labour agrees they must. The five-month hiatus has been a disaster for many kids‚Äô education and mental health and widened further the gap between state and private schools.</p> \n   <p>It is vital that we also maintain calm perspective if the virus does break out in some schools, as it inevitably will.</p> \n   <p>Too many are terrified simply by an uptick in cases. But they only really matter if they result in hospitalisations or deaths. And those are now extremely rare ‚Äî even more so among the young.</p> \n   <p>Medics are certain schools are safe.</p> \n   <p><strong>The damage done by keeping kids off will vastly exceed the tiny threat to their health.</strong></p> \n  </div> \n </div> \n</div> \n<!--googleoff: all--> \n<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\"> \n <div class=\"sun-row \"> \n  <div \n</div> \n<!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} --> \n<!--googleon: all--> \n<p>Downing Street says the country‚Äôs improved testing regime means it is not a problem for millions of kids to head back to class.</p> \n<p>And <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/11938066/schools-full-attendance-in-september/\">Boris Johnson</a> reassured anxious parents it is safe in schools by insisting the risk is ‚Äúvery, very low‚Äù.</p> \n<p>The PM, in a Twitter video, said transport is ‚Äúno obstacle‚Äù as the Government is putting extra money into beefing up local services.</p> \n<div class=\"article-boxout\"> \n <div class=\"article-boxout__header theme__background-color\"> \n  <h3 class=\"article-boxout__headline\">No mask in lesson</h3> \n </div> \n <div class=\"article-boxout__content theme__background-color-rgba-20\"> \n  <div> \n   <p><strong>KIDS will not have to wear masks in the classroom ‚Äì despite Scotland pushing ahead with the controversial move.</strong></p> \n   <p>England‚Äôs ministers said it ‚Äúwould obstruct communication between teachers and pupils‚Äù.</p> \n  </div> \n </div> \n</div> \n<!-- Start of Brightcove Player --> \n<div 08:41:46","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:41:46","title":"Hundreds of Benidorm club owners and bar staff protest ‚Äòabsurd‚Äô new coronavirus restrictions that will ‚Äòdestroy‚Äô resort","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12488200/benidorm-club-bar-staff-protest-new-coronavirus-restrictions/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>HUNDREDS of Benidorm club owners and bar staff have staged a protest about new coronavirus restrictions they claim will destroy the resort.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Clubs and bars open in the evening have been closed down as a way of containing the spread of the coronavirus, in particular among young people.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><strong><img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/26a0.png\" alt=\"‚ö†\" class=\"wp-smiley\" style=\"height: 1em; max-height: 1em;\" /> Read our <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12383728/coronavirus-uk-news-deaths-live-latest-schools/\">coronavirus live blog</a> for the latest news &#38; updates</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12488809\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000602805052.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12488809\" width=\"960\" height=\"603\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>EPA</figcredit></figure>Holidaymakers having a drink in an almost empty bar in Benidorm[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12488400\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603612187.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12488400\" width=\"960\" height=\"672\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>EPA</figcredit></figure>Bar, club and restaurant owners took to the streets to vent their anger[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>The resort&#8217;s woes come on top of the UK government&#8217;s decision to impose a <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/travel/12296716/benidorm-brit-ban-spain-cheap-holidays/\">14 day quarantine</a> on travellers returning from Spain, which has seen its once bustling nightlife reduced to a shadow of its former self.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>A recent spike in coronavirus infections on the Costa Blanca, which includes Benidorm, has been blamed on <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12445693/coronavirus-costa-blanca-party-lovers-breach-lockdown-rules/\">young partygoers failing to observe social distancing.</a></p>\n\n\n\n<p>Those aged between 15-34 now account for nearly half of the new cases on the Costa Blanca and throughout<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/where/spain/\"> Spain</a>, the recent rise in infections has been blamed on young people socialising.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Restaurants and bars that have not been forced to shutter completely now have to close at 1am.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>In response, a demonstration was called by the associations representing bar owners, restaurants and clubs.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12488575\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000510221420.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12488575\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Alamy</figcredit></figure>The resorts bars are normally thronging with Brits [/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Around a 1000 people gathered for a march in Benidorm town centre that finished in a rally outside the town hall.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>They were joined by some of the resorts tribute acts including Simon Meatloaf, who has been out of work for months.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>‚ÄúBenidorm is safe and clean. This is not a decision to protect health, it‚Äôs a political one,‚Äù he <a href=\"https://www.euroweeklynews.com/2020/08/23/protest-in-benidorm-on-spains-costa-blanca-attracts-hundreds-of-brit-and-spanish-demonstrators/\">told Euro Weekly News</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Fellow entertainer Jonny Hellraizer who said his last gig was on March 13 has not worked of received any government support since.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>‚ÄúI have not been able to work for five months and have received no money or help from the government.‚Äù</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603849766.jpg?strip=all&w=785","linkMd5":"96998ade433f308d3b6991eb1e20e1b0","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn61@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-41-49-523_3190fe9ed88ddeaa.webp","destWidth":785,"destHeight":960,"sourceBytes":124550,"destBytes":124550,"author":"Mary Gallagher","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603849766.jpg?strip=all&w=785":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn61@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-41-49-523_3190fe9ed88ddeaa.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603849740.jpg?strip=all&w=708":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn5@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-41-54-467_94a8fb5c4f957b71.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603849734.jpg?strip=all&w=839":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn70@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-42-00-360_546f3dbdbb723009.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603849768.jpg?strip=all&w=689":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn3@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-42-02-925_a617be9add2c7357.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603849714.jpg?strip=all&w=805":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn27@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-42-01-306_43624840263fc181.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603849774.jpg?strip=all&w=607":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn51@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-42-02-677_daae65c39b6c23d1.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/08a00894-2ef8-4547-b09e-31bbcc1ced83.jpg?strip=all&w=357":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn71@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-42-04-147_ef3d80bf79366888.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316106178},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:41:46","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:41:46","title":"Cheerleader, 20, dies after ‚Äòrunning laps in the sweltering heat as punishment for dance routine mistake‚Äô","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12488942/cheerleader-dies-running-heat-punishment-mistake/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>A CHEERLEADER died after being made to run laps in the sweltering heat for making mistakes in a dance routine practice, her family claim.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Phornphiphat Eaddam, 20, was taking part in an event on the volleyball court at the Phuket Ratchapat University in southern <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/where/thailand/\">Thailand</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489133\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603739828.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489133\" width=\"960\" height=\"721\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>ViralPress</figcredit></figure>Phornphiphat Eaddam collapsed after running in the heat[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489135\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 796px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603739796.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=786\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489135\" width=\"786\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>ViralPress</figcredit></figure>She died in hospital the following day [/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>But she reportedly made mistakes during the routine and was ordered to run eight laps of the court in the heat without any water.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Phornphiphat, whose nickname was &#8216;Mint&#8217;, collapsed on the seventh lap and was rushed to the Vachira Phuket Hospital where she was treated in the intensive care unit.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The next day the student&#8217;s heart stopped functioning for 16 minutes and medics were unable to revive her.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Phornphiphat&#8217;s devastated family have now made a police complaint after university bosses allegedly wrongly told them that she had died from fainting.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Her older sister Wilawan said that doctors found Phornphiphat&#8217;s lungs were bleeding and that she died of extreme physical exertion.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Phornphiphat had had no pre-existing medical conditions, her family say.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Her grieving father, Kanong Eaddam, 43, said the family was told his daughter was rushed to hospital after cheerleading practice.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>‚ÄúWe drove to the hospital and found my daughter was already in intensive care. She could not make it, she later died after she had been given CPR,‚Äù he said.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Kanong said he wants the university and the cheerleading team to tell the truth about his daughter&#8217;s death.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The university dean Theerapong Noochaikaew claimed that Phornphiphat&#8217;s &#160;death was not related to &#8221;hazing&#8221;, a form of university initiation.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;We need to wait for the post-mortem examination, and during this time we will question more witnesses. It was not university hazing, it was just one of the sports activities,‚Äù he said.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>‚ÄúThe finding of the inquiry will be made public later.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603888886.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=808\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489006\" width=\"808\" height=\"557\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Reuters</figcredit></figure>Brazilian legend Ronaldinho was pictured arriving at court on Monday[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489009\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603889414.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489009\" width=\"960\" height=\"643\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Reuters</figcredit></figure>The Brazilian legend is hoping to be allowed to return to his homeland[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>The football legend, who insisted on appearing at the trial in person, has been under house-arrest in Asuncion since April after <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/11350702/ronaldinho-house-arrest-prison-paraguay-brazil-passport/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">serving 32 days in prison</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Lawyers of the 40-year-old, who was pictured arriving at a Paraguayan court on Monday, maintain that the brothers did not know the documents were falsified, as they were given to them by a local sponsor upon landing.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>One of the lawyers said: ‚ÄúThere is no indication that he has any personal characteristics or criminal behaviour that ‚Ä¶ would put society at risk.‚Äù</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Both <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/who/ronaldinho/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\">Ronaldinho</a> and Roberto pleaded guilty to entering the country with fake passports and paid a ¬£152,000 fine, but will return to Brazil with conditional freedom.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489011\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603891382.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489011\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>AFP or licensors</figcredit></figure>He insisted on attending the trial in person[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Roberto, who also acts as his brother&#8217;s agent, has agreed to keep a criminal record in Paraguay and must check in with authorities every three months over the next two years, during which time he will not be allowed to leave his home country.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Ronaldinho&#8217;s criminal record will be expunged as part of the deal.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Back in April, he said on the legal trouble: &#8220;I never imagined that something like this could happen to me. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;It was a big blow. Everything we do is under the contracts that are managed by my brother.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;We were absolutely surprised to learn that the documents we had were not legal. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;Our intention was always to collaborate with the courts to clarify the facts.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>‚ÄúI always have my faith. I always pray for things to go well and hopefully soon all this will come to an end.‚Äù</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t<blockquote class=\"article__quote\">\n\t\t<div class=\"article__quote-copy theme__before-color theme__after-color\">\n\t\t\t<p>I always have my faith. I always pray for things to go well and hopefully soon all this will come to an end</p>\n\t\t\t\t<cite class=\"article__quote-credit theme__copy-color\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class=\"quote-credit\">Ronaldinho</span>\t\t\t\t</cite>\n\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t</blockquote>\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>South American media have claimed during his detention that the brothers spent their house arrest in a ¬£300-a-night suites in a luxury hotel.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Despite their supposed quarantine during the coronavirus pandemic, there were reports that Ronaldinho was able to welcome guests to his room and spent the nights dancing and singing karaoke</p>\n\n\n\n<p>During his earlier 32-day stint in jail, Ronaldinho was convinced to <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/11172770/ronaldinho-goal-video-prison-futsal-paraguay-brazil/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">play in a six-aside futsal tournament</a> at Agrupacion Especializada prison.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Unsurprisingly, he led his team to victory &#8211; scoring five times and laying on six assists in the 11-2 triumph.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489015\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603888889.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489015\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Reuters</figcredit></figure>The 40-year-old has been stuck in Paraguay since March[/caption]\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div including the Champions League and World Cup, rather than a trophy or medal, his prize was a 16kg pig.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>His lawyer Adolfo Marin has argued the defence that Ronaldinho and his brother did not know that the documents they were given in a VIP room upon arrival in Paraguay were faked.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And Marin said of his client: &#8220;He&#8217;s thick. He didn&#8217;t realise he was receiving fake documents&#8221;.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489016\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img 08:41:46","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:41:46","title":"Monster mum strangles son, 4, to death and kills herself after telling husband she was out buying lad new shoes","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12489763/mum-strangles-son-to-death-buying-shoes/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>A MUM strangled her son to death after telling her husband she was out buying the boy new shoes.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/where/italy/\">Italian</a> police have said Viviana Parisi, 43, strangled her four-year-old son Gioele to death before throwing herself off an electricity pylon.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489785\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 462px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Newsflash-MomItaly-03.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=452\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489785\" width=\"452\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Newsflash</figcredit></figure>Police have said Viviana Parisi killed her son Gioele¬†[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489789\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 759px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Newsflash-MomItaly-02.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=749\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489789\" width=\"749\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Gioele was just four-years-old</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>Viviana, a DJ from Turin, had told her husband Daniele Mondello that she had taken Gioele to buy news shoes when she left their home.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>She had reportedly been suffering anxiety and &#8220;feared for the family&#8221; during <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12463443/italy-highest-daily-coronavirus-infections-may-second-wav-holiday-hotspot/\">Italy&#8217;s strict coronavirus lockdown</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>It is believed she deliberately left her phone behind to stop anyone being able to track her location.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Cops believe she was originally driving towards a viaduct on the Messina-Palermo motorway where she planned to kill herself.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>However, the Opel Corsa they were travelling in was involved in a crash with a van in a tunnel in northern Sicily. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>CCTV captured the mum and son in the car and authorities spoke to a family who stopped to help them.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Parisi was described by witnesses as &#8220;extremely agitated&#8221; and was seen carrying Gioele in her arms as she climbed over the guard rail and into the wilderness.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>She is then believed to have strangled the boy before climbing 50ft up an electrical pylon and jumping to her death.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The mum and son were <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12375480/massive-hunt-for-missing-boy-4-after-unrecognisable-body-of-his-dj-mum-is-found-in-remote-wilderness-in-italy/\">reported missing on August 3</a> and police worked to scour a 400-hectare area of remote wilderness.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Parisi&#8217;s body was found five days later suffering a broken back and animal bites.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Police finally found Gioele&#8217;s body on August 19, which had been hidden in a ditch and concealed under stones and shrubs.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489801\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Newsflash-MomTot-01.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489801\" width=\"960\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Viviana Parisi with Gioele and her husband Daniele Mondello</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489807\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 728px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Newsflash-MomItaly-01.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=718\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489807\" width=\"718\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Daniele Mondello doesn&#8217;t believe Viviana Parisi killed Gioele</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>Heartbreaking photos showed the boy&#8217;s coffin being carried by emergency workers after they recovered his remains. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Pictures show his dad Daniele, also a DJ, with his hands covering his face as he appeared to weep.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Gioele&#8217;s remains had reportedly been <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12456880/italy-body-missing-boy-eaten-animals-mum-corpse-car/\">partially eaten by animals</a> &#8211; and police originally theorised he may have been killed in an animal attack.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Cops tried desperately to piece together what happened before eventually settling that the tragic incident was a murder-suicide.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Chief prosecutor Angelo Cavallo  said police were satisfied that Parisi killed her son, hid his body and then took her own life.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Daniele however has protested his wife&#8217;s innocence, saying &#8220;Viviana didn&#8217;t kill him, she loved him too much&#8221;.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489817\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Newsflash-ItalyBoy-01.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489817\" width=\"960\" height=\"524\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Daniele Mondello appears to weep as they found Gioele&#8217;s body</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489948\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Newsflash-ItalyBoy-02.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489948\" width=\"960\" height=\"490\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Gioele&#8217;s body is removed by emergency workers</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>Taking to social media, Daniele said: &#8220;My wife has never touched my son even with a finger. I still believe they were attacked by animals.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Daniele added: &#8220;As long as I live and Viviana and Gioele give me the strength to go on. I will fight until my death to know the truth. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;My pain has no boundaries but I am not willing to tolerate more mud on Viviana, me or my family</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Parisi recently suffered a psychological breakdown, with her condition aggravated by the lockdown and she had previously attempted suicide in June.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div -->\n\t</div><!-- .sun-row .{row} .rail-video-index-->\n\t</div> <!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>Daniele said his wife had &#8220;feared for the family&#8221; due to &#8220;months of forced confinement&#8221; and had been taking medication.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Prosecutors had originally theorised both mum and son may have been attacked and murdered in a sexual assault, or killed in an animal attack.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Gioele&#8217;s body was found by 55-year-old volunteer Giuseppe Di Bello, a former cop who joined the search.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He said: &#8220;I found it where no one had looked for it. I moved some bushes and the remains were there.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p><strong>If you are affected by any of the issues raised in this article, please call the Samaritans for free
