\n    </div>\n    <!-- .swiper-container --> \n   </div>\n   <!-- .rail .{rail} .swiper-video-rail .{theme-slug} --> \n  </div>\n  <!-- .col .sun-col-6 --> \n </div>\n <!-- .sun-row .{row} .rail-video-index--> \n</div> \n<!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} --> \n<!--googleon: all--> \n<p>Cynthia Lawton wrote: ‚ÄúIs that all the council has got to worry about? What about drug dealers trading outside schools? What about litter in the street?‚Äù</p> \n<p>And Nathan Farrell insisted: ‚ÄúThis is a really, really good deed, loads of homeless people in need of food, kids going hungry and people struggling financially so to offer free food to anyone is really good.‚Äù</p> \n<p>The council has since withdrawn the fine and apologised. It said it ‚Äúrecognises that the spirit of the residents‚Äô actions was with good intentions‚Äù.</p> \n<!-- Start of Brightcove Player --> \n<div style=\"display: block; position: relative; min-width: 0px; max-width: 640px;\"> \n <div style=\"padding-top: 56%; \"> \n  <video data-video-id=\"6181897720001\" data-account=\"5067014667001\" data-player=\"default\" data-usage=\"cms:wordpress:5.4.2:1.7.0:javascript\" data-embed=\"default\" class=\"video-js\" controls=\"\" style=\"width: 100%; height: 100%; position: absolute; top: 0; bottom: 0; right: 0; left: 0;\"> \n  </video> \n  <script src=\"https://players.brightcove.net/5067014667001/default_default/index.min.js\"></script> \n </div> \n</div> \n<!-- End of Brightcove Player --> \n<p><strong>GOT a story? RING The Sun on 0207 782 4104 or WHATSAPP on 07423720250 or EMAIL&nbsp;<a href=\"mailto:exclusive@the-sun.co.uk\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">exclusive@the-sun.co.uk</a></strong></p>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 21:35:56 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/f74b2d85-64d4-4b1e-b759-54d105f0d7b7.jpg?strip=all&w=382","linkMd5":"bf3a33dbe48cf5691ae33b98f4bec538","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn93@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-41-47-651_63fe9ff6fbc8cb2e.webp","destWidth":382,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":33750,"destBytes":33750,"author":"Vicky Lytaki","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/f74b2d85-64d4-4b1e-b759-54d105f0d7b7.jpg?strip=all&w=382":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn93@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-41-47-651_63fe9ff6fbc8cb2e.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603828656.jpg?strip=all&w=540":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn78@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-41-56-520_d1cc385c3ec986b5.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316106287},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:41:46","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:41:46","title":"Why all single mums like me should be eligible for free IVF on the NHS","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/fabulous/12488955/single-mums-eligible-free-ivf-on-nhs/","description":"<p><strong>A CRUEL postcode lottery means women in more than 20 NHS regions are denied access to fertility treatment if they cannot prove they are in a stable relationship.</strong></p> \n<p>A freedom of information request to all 135 clinical commissioning groups (CCGs) by the British Pregnancy Association found huge disparity relating to who could qualify.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12489157\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000601942013.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489157\" width=\"960\" height=\"960\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Luci Schofield\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Genevieve Roberts says single mums should be eligible for free IVF[/caption] \n<p>In some areas, such as Cornwall and Barnsley, couples had to show they had a joint bank account.</p> \n<p>But mum-of-two GENEVIEVE ROBERTS, author of Going Solo: My Choice To Become A Single Mother Using A Donor,‚Ää says it should not matter whether you are in a relationship or not.</p> \n<p>The 41-year-old writer had Astrid, three, and Xavi, one, through a sperm donor.</p> \n<p>Here, she says why having a partner does not necessarily make you a better parent.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12489161\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000601749210.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489161\" width=\"960\" height=\"960\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  instagram/genevieve_roberts\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Roberts is mum to Astrid, three, and Xavi, one, through a sperm donor[/caption] \n<p>‚ÄúI ROARED with laughter when I read that the NHS in Cornwall judges the seriousness of your partnership by whether or not you have a joint bank account.</p> \n<p>For me, the idea of shared statements is no more appealing than a joint email address. Given that money is the cause of most arguments between couples, separate accounts may also make for a more harmonious life. </p> \n<p>I was married, fleetingly, and I don‚Äôt remember us considering pooling our resources.</p> \n<p>When are we all going to realise that it‚Äôs not what a family looks like on the outside that counts, but love and security?</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12489165\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000601749224.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489165\" width=\"960\" height=\"960\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  instagram/genevieve_roberts\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Astrid was born through IUI while Xavi was born through IVF[/caption] \n<p>I‚Äôm a solo mum and it was the biggest and best decision that I‚Äôve made, and that I will ever make.</p> \n<p>My two children were both conceived using a sperm donor.</p> \n<p>The stereotype of a career woman who forgets about family until it‚Äôs too late couldn‚Äôt have been further from my truth: I‚Äôd have loved to have had kids in my early thirties.</p> \n<p>I had my fertility tested when I was 37 and single. My previous relationship ended weeks after a miscarriage and it had taken a long time to come to terms with that double loss.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12489168\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000601941981.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489168\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Luci Schofield\n </figcredit>\n</figure>The author felt like she had an army of supporters as she went through fertility treatment[/caption] \n<p>My concerns were whether I could carry a child, rather than getting pregnant, so I was devastated to be told my fertility levels were very low.</p> \n<p>Even as a child I‚Äôd taken it for granted that one day I‚Äôd become a mum; that future felt as if it was slipping away. </p> \n<p>I realised I had choices: either I waited to fall in love with a partner, and accepted this might mean no chance of having kids, or I tried to become a solo parent.</p> \n<p>The idea of not even trying to have children felt heartbreaking. I spoke to friends and family and it felt like I had an army of supporters as I went through fertility treatment. </p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12489171\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000601749222.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489171\" width=\"960\" height=\"960\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  instagram/genevieve_roberts\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Her previous relationship ended weeks after a miscarriage[/caption] \n<p>My mum‚Äôs first reaction was concern that I was choosing a hard path for myself, but when I explained to her how hard the feeling of longing to have children is, and how prepared I was to look after a child, she offered me her full support.</p> \n<p>I didn‚Äôt qualify for IVF on the NHS. At the time there was no question of single people accessing the service where I lived, and today 48 per cent of clinical commissioning groups (CCGs) still do not give treatment to single women.</p> \n<p>In 14 areas, women above 35 don‚Äôt get treatment, while 24 CCGs want to see a relationship that has lasted more than two years. </p> \n<p>That means that women in Berkshire, Oxfordshire and North Staffordshire need to have met their partner by 33 to qualify for IVF fertility treatment. No pressure there then.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12489176\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000601749212.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489176\" width=\"960\" height=\"960\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  instagram/genevieve_roberts\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Genevieve Roberts turned to private treatment because she didn‚Äôt qualify for IVF on the NHS[/caption] \n<p>The National Institute of Clinical Excellence guidelines say a woman should be eligible for NHS-funded IVF, costing about ¬£5,000 per cycle, if she is under 43 and has been trying to get pregnant for two years. But different CCGs make it up as they go along.</p> \n<p>I went private. I conceived my daughter by artificial insemination, known as IUI, and my son by IVF, which is more intrusive. I had to inject myself with hormones that left me bloated, and then multiple eggs were retrieved by a consultant from my ovaries, while I was sedated.</p> \n<p>My mum took my daughter out to play in the park while I had the procedure. When I woke up, back in a ward bed, I felt momentarily confused. </p> \n<p>Two eggs got fertilised and the embryos were put back in me ‚Äî my son is the result.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12489191\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000601749214.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489191\" width=\"960\" height=\"960\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  instagram/genevieve_roberts\n </figcredit>\n</figure>The author explains why having a partner does not necessarily make you a better parent[/caption] \n<p>When I was pregnant with him, I found myself wishing I had more energy to play with my daughter. An imaginary partner would have looked after us both so I could have rested more, I suppose.</p> \n<p>When I was pregnant with both my children, women a generation older than me got in touch to tell me that they wished they had been as brave as me.</p> \n<p>I know how lucky I am ‚Äî and how lucky my children are. They are rich in love, not only from me but from their family, friends and neighbours.</p> \n<p>Watching their sibling relationship grow ‚Äî a friendship that I hope will long outlast me ‚Äî gives me great joy. Some things would be much easier in a couple: financially ‚Äî physically and emotionally.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12489201\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 650px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000601941986.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=640\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489201\" width=\"640\" height=\"960\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Luci Schofield\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Roberts‚Äô biggest fear is dying too young[/caption] \n<p>My friends and family celebrated my son‚Äôs first steps a month ago but I‚Äôd love someone to find it as funny as me that my three-year-old tells me she‚Äôs a grown-up now.</p> \n<p>My biggest secret fear, one that creeps up when I‚Äôm overtired, is the effect on my children if I died too young. I find it hard to contemplate. </p> \n<p>Some people think solo-parenting is selfish and I‚Äôm sure some people do make negative comments about our family, but it hasn‚Äôt happened to my face. </p> \n<p>I‚Äôd invite them to spend time with my kids before judging. It is also worth looking at the research.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12489214\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000601941997.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489214\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Luci Schofield\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Her children are rich in love and support from family, friends and neighbours[/caption] \n<p>While exploring the effect of parenting alone, for my book Going Solo, I spoke to Dr Sophie Zadeh, a lecturer at University College London. She told me one thing solo mothers tend to have in common is being good parents.</p> \n<p>‚ÄúThat‚Äôs probably true of all parents who use assisted reproduction methods,‚Äù she said.</p> \n<p>This is the reality of all families who face the postcode lottery to have invasive fertility treatment: our children are so very wanted and planned. Dr Zadeh looked into whether a one-parent family is destabilising for children. </p> \n<p>She found that unlike children of divorced parents ‚Äî who can suffer because of parental conflict before, during and after their parents break up, and from a drop in financial circumstances ‚Äî there is no difference between children in one-parent and two-parent families.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12489221\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000601942018.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489221\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Luci Schofield\n </figcredit>\n</figure>She‚Äôll be happy to have a partner again in the future[/caption] \n<p>I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll have a partner again in the future. I‚Äôd be happy to share my life and home, but I‚Äôm doubtful about shared banking. </p> \n<p>Yet for couples facing infertility treatment in certain places, if they don‚Äôt bank together, the NHS won‚Äôt fund their IVF. So alongside the hormone injections, egg collection and anguish of fertility problems there‚Äôs an extra hoop to jump through.</p> \n<p>I do dream of a day when I can lie in beyond 6am, but watching my children grow, become curious about the world and start to cause mischief together is the most wonderful thing I could imagine.</p> \n<!--googleoff: all--> \n<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\"> \n <div class=\"sun-row \"> \n  <div class=\"col sun-col-6\"> \n   <div class=\"rail rail--classic  rail--trending theme-fabulous\" data-slide-count=\"4\" .rail-video-index--> \n</div> \n<!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} --> \n<!--googleon: all--> \n<p>I‚Äôd love to be able to give my children everything in the world, and so I do reflect on the fact I‚Äôve not been able to give them a dad. </p> \n<p>But I‚Äôm reassured they have strong male role models in their lives. We talk about our family a lot and I hope I‚Äôm bringing them up with the security, confidence and openness to ask questions as they grow older.</p> \n<p>We are lucky to live in a time where women and men have freedom to choose only good relationships, because being single doesn‚Äôt affect whether or not we can create a loving and secure family. And banking has nothing to do with it.</p> \n<ul>\n <li><strong>Genevieve Roberts is the author of Going Solo: My Choice To Become A Single Mother Using A Donor, published by Little, Brown, priced ¬£13.99</strong></li>\n</ul> \n<!-- Start of Brightcove Player --> \n<div style=\"display: block; position: relative; min-width: 0px; max-width: 640px;\"> \n <div style=\"padding-top: 56%; \"> \n  <video data-video-id=\"6184032372001\" data-account=\"5067014667001\" data-player=\"default\" data-usage=\"cms:wordpress:5.4.2:1.7.0:javascript\" data-embed=\"default\" class=\"video-js\" controls=\"\" style=\"width: 100%; height: 100%; position: absolute; top: 0; bottom: 0; right: 0; left: 0;\"> \n  </video> \n  <script src=\"https://players.brightcove.net/5067014667001/default_default/index.min.js\"></script> \n </div> \n</div> \n<!-- End of Brightcove Player --> \n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" /> \n<p><strong>GOT a story? _4101ef914c779b5c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316106181},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 boyfriend‚Äô","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12488801/mum-screams-doused-petrol-set-alight-by-monster-boyfriend/","description":"<p>A TERRIFIED mum screamed at neighbours for help after being covered in petrol and set alight by her boyfriend, allege cops in Australia.</p> \n<p>The woman, in her 20s, was left with horrendous burns to 35 per cent of her body after neighbours saved her life by putting out the flames, say reports.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12488966\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 618px\">\n <img </figcredit>\n</figure>The woman in her 20s managed to run from the house[/caption] \n<p>After the attack occurred in Perth at about 1.15pm on Sunday, she was rushed to Fiona Stanley Hospital, where she remains in a stable condition.</p> \n<p>Neighbour Teresa Mitchell told <a href=\"https://www.abc.net.au/news/2020-08-24/woman-set-on-fire-by-man-in-medina-home-in-perth-police-say/12589066\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">ABC News</a> that she could hear the victim ‚Äúscreaming and yelling from across the road‚Äù.</p> \n<p>She added: ‚ÄúIt was like you hear from a wounded animal ‚Äì a gut-wrenching scream.‚Äù</p> \n<p>Ms Mitchell also told <a href=\"https://www.9news.com.au/national/western-australian-medina-perth-woman-burned-by-man-who-set-her-alight/1ffebbb2-e3e2-4bfb-8211-41b923fffbe7\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Nine News</a>: ‚ÄúShe was staggering across the road, towards here, screaming my name, screaming for me to help her.‚Äù</p> \n<p>The neighbour cared for mum-of-two Andrea Atkins-Greed by putting her under the shower, but it wasn‚Äôt enough to stop the severe pain.</p> \n<p>She told the ABC that Ms Atkins-Greed was laid on a floor, while cold water was ‚Äúpoured over her until the ambulance could get here‚Äù.</p> \n<p>Ms Mitchell said she could see where the mum‚Äôs clothing was, as ‚Äúthose part of her weren‚Äôt burnt‚Äù.</p> \n<p>Another neighbour described Ms Atkins-Greed as a ‚Äúnice girl.. the most friendly, enthusiastic person‚Äù.</p> \n<p>But, he admitted to being worried as her condition is ‚Äúnot great‚Äù.</p> \n<p>He said he hoped she would be operated on this week.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12488965\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 934px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603890787.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=924\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12488965\" width=\"924\" height=\"544\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  9news\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Neighbour Teresa Mitchell managed to save the mum-of-two by extinguishing the flames, and putting her under cold water till ambulances arrived[/caption] \n<figure id=\"attachment_12488977\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img house[/caption] \n<figure id=\"attachment_12488979\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img height=\"501\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  9news\n </figcredit>\n</figure>The woman was ‚Äòscreaming for help‚Äô a neighbour said[/caption] \n<p>The man has spoken with the victim‚Äôs mum, asking her to pass on his and other neighbours‚Äô good wishes.</p> \n<p>The man added that ‚Äúit‚Äôs not fair‚Äù that she would be ‚Äúscarred for life‚Äù, particularly as she has two daughters.</p> \n<p>The Western Australia Police Force said on Facebook that ‚Äúarson squad detectives have charged a man after it is alleged he set fire to a woman known to him.</p> \n<p>‚ÄúIt is alleged the man was at a home in Medina when he doused part of the lounge room and the woman with petrol and set it alight.</p> \n<p>‚ÄúThe woman in her 20s managed to run from the house and neighbours were able to put out the flames and call emergency services. </p> \n<p>‚ÄúShe was conveyed by ambulance to Fiona Stanley Hospital with burns to 35 per cent of her body.</p> \n<p>‚ÄúThe man was also taken to Fiona Stanley Hospital for treatment for burns.‚Äù</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12488972\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 607px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603890794.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=597\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12488972\" width=\"597\" height=\"476\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  9news\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Ms Atkins-Greed screamed like a ‚Äòwounded animal‚Äô, Nine News was told[/caption] \n<figure id=\"attachment_12488973\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603890793.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12488973\" width=\"960\" height=\"440\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  9news\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Neighbours helped put out the flames[/caption] \n<p>A 37-year-old man from Medina has been charged with acts intended to cause Grievous Bodily Harm and criminal damage by fire, the force added.</p> \n<p>The arrested man has been named in local media as her boyfriend Daniel Bolderson.</p> \n<p>He appeared before the Perth Magistrates Court ‚Äì via a bedside hearing ‚Äì on Monday, August 24, and was remanded until Wednesday.</p> \n<div class=\"article-boxout\"> \n <div class=\"article-boxout__header theme__background-color\"> \n  <h3 class=\"article-boxout__headline\">HOW YOU CAN GET HELP:</h3> \n </div> \n <div class=\"article-boxout__content theme__background-color-rgba-20\"> \n  <div> \n   <p>Women‚Äôs Aid has this advice for victims and their families:</p> \n   <ul> \n    <li>Always keep your phone nearby.</li> \n    <li>Get in touch with charities for help, including the Women‚Äôs Aid live chat helpline and services such as SupportLine.</li> \n    <li>If you are in danger, call 999.</li> \n    <li>Familiarise yourself with the Silent Solution, reporting abuse without speaking down the phone, instead dialing ‚Äú55‚Äù.</li> \n    <li>Always keep some money on you, including change for a pay phone or bus fare.</li> \n    <li>If you suspect your partner is about to attack you, try to go to a lower-risk area of the house ‚Äì for example, where there is a way out and access to a telephone.</li> \n    <li>Avoid the kitchen and garage, where there are likely to be knives or other weapons. Avoid rooms where you might become trapped, such as the bathroom, or where you might be shut into a cupboard or other small space.</li> \n   </ul> \n   <p>If you are a ¬≠victim of domestic abuse, SupportLine is open Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday from 6pm to 8pm on 01708 765200. The charity‚Äôs email support ¬≠service is open weekdays and weekends during the crisis ‚Äì&nbsp;<a href=\"mailto:messageinfo@supportline.org.uk\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">messageinfo@supportline.org.uk</a>.</p> \n   <p>Women‚Äôs Aid provides a&nbsp;<a href=\"http://chat.womensaid.%20org.uk/\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\" target=\"_blank\">live chat service available</a>. from 10am to noon.</p> \n   <p>You can also call the freephone 24-hour ¬≠National Domestic Abuse Helpline on 0808 2000 247.</p> \n  </div> \n </div> \n</div> \n<!--googleoff: all--> WEEK‚Äô","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/12116744/arsenal-transfer-news-live-gabriel-magalhaes-coutinho-aubameyang/","description":"<p><b>GABRIEL MAGALHAES has landed in London to complete his 08:41:46","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:41:46","title":"Brussels is still bent on ensuring that Britain somehow loses out","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12489926/brussels-ensure-britain-loses-out/","description":"<h2 class=\"has-text-align-center\">That‚Äôs a ‚Äònon‚Äô</h2> \n<p><strong>OUR hearts go out, really they do, to the Eurocrats apparently now downcast over the prospect of us leaving the EU with no trade deal. But what did they expect?</strong></p> \n<p>It is incredible after all this time to see Brussels still bent on ensuring that Britain somehow loses out, so fixated are they on deterring others from ¬≠abandoning their club.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12490071\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000597607460.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12490071\" width=\"960\" height=\"627\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Reuters\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Michel Barnier, pictured with the PM‚Äôs Brexit negotiator, won‚Äôt get his way[/caption] \n<p>They are still making patently unreasonable power grabs even their europhile fans struggle to defend. They still want newly-independent Britain to surrender full control of our fishing waters. To agree economic restrictions to prevent us undercutting them and keep us under their thumb.</p> \n<p>They simply must change the record <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12489673/brussels-gloom-about-clinching-brexit-trade-deal-as-talks-enter-final-three-weeks-before-deadline/\">if they‚Äôre genuinely worried</a> about the potential hardship of us trading on WTO terms ‚Äî and them copping the blame. No objective person will fault Britain for sticking to its guns on principles so fundamental.</p> \n<p>Michel Barnier won‚Äôt get his way. He and those pulling his strings seem strangely unable to digest that the Theresa May regime is gone, that voters threw out the Remainer Parliament and installed committed Brexiteers instead.</p> \n<p>We do agree with Barnier that negotiations seem dead in the water and a ‚Äúno deal‚Äù looks nailed on. But the blame for the lost jobs, there and here, will fall squarely at Brussels‚Äô feet.</p> \n<p><strong>They are wedded to impossible demands no sovereign nation could meet.</strong></p> \n<h2 class=\"has-text-align-center\">Fine by us</h2> \n<p><strong>NO ONE relishes nervous parents being punished for keeping kids off school. But if that is the impetus they need as a last resort to conquer their Covid fear, so be it.</strong></p> \n<p>Normal sanctions must apply once schools go back, as even Labour agrees they must. The five-month hiatus has been a disaster for many kids‚Äô education and mental health and widened further the gap between state and private schools.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12490072\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000571772971.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12490072\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Alamy\n </figcredit>\n</figure>The Government is ramping up the campaign to get all kids back to school [/caption] \n<p>It is vital that we also maintain calm perspective if the virus does break out in some schools, as it inevitably will.</p> \n<p>Too many are terrified simply by an uptick in cases. But they only really matter if they result in hospitalisations or deaths. And those are now extremely rare ‚Äî <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12489688/schools-kids-avoid-detention-covid-19/\">even more so among the young</a>.</p> \n<p>Medics are certain schools are safe.</p> \n<p><strong>The damage done by keeping kids off will vastly exceed the tiny threat to their health.</strong></p> \n<h2 class=\"has-text-align-center\">Fruit loops</h2> \n<p><strong>THEY say no good deed goes unpunished.</strong></p> \n<p>That‚Äôs especially so when councils employ jobsworths who revel in their power to dish out fines.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12489989\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 550px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603828656-1.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=540\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489989\" width=\"540\" height=\"960\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">\n  A nurse left free apples outside her home for passers-by ‚Äì and got fined\n </figcaption>\n <figcredit></figcredit>\n</figure> \n<!--googleoff: all--> \n<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\"> \n <div class=\"sun-row \"> \n  <div class=\"col sun-col-6\"> tourists dropping litter and ignoring coronavirus rules","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12489946/security-guards-patrol-snowdon-tourists-litter/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>SECURITY guards have been brought in to patrol the village at the foot of Snowdown &#8211; as tourists drop litter and ignore coronavirus rules.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Brits on staycations have largely behaved themselves at the hikers hotspot, but some louts have camped illegally, abandoned mounts of rubbish and started fires.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><strong><img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/26a0.png\" alt=\"‚ö†\" class=\"wp-smiley\" style=\"height: 1em; max-height: 1em;\" /> Read our <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12383728/coronavirus-uk-news-deaths-live-latest-schools/\">coronavirus live blog</a> for the latest news &#38; updates</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489995\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000565683263.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489995\" width=\"960\" height=\"638\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Alamy</figcredit></figure>The mountain and the village below will have security guards patrolling[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489997\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000594967331.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489997\" width=\"960\" height=\"644\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Reuters</figcredit></figure>Thousands have headed to Snowdown amid the pandemic[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Locals left exasperated by the damage done have got a security firm to look after the bottom of the 3,560ft mountain.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Following complaints from villagers, who also claimed that social distancing was not observed, Gwynedd council has decided to fight back.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Police, National Park wardens, the National Trust and Natural Resources Wales will also join the effort to curb the trouble and clear up mess.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>In a letter to residents posted online Sian Gwenllian, local Plaid Cymru member of the <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/where/wales/\">Welsh </a>Senedd, said: ‚ÄúI understand that it is a worrying time for Llanberis residents, and many feel unsafe in their own village.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Llanberis Development Group, an organisation set up to promote the area as a tourist destination and protect the environment, said:  &#8220;We need our visitors but not all of them have been behaving in a <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/topic/coronavirus/\">Covid-19</a> responsible way.‚Äù</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The ‚Äústaycation‚Äù popularity has provided a late summer boost for businesses hit by the pandemic, but also brought an influx of careless tourists.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Narrow roads have also been clogged up with vehicles parked illegally by mountain walkers. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>A number of visitors have returned to find their cars towed away. </p>\n\n\n\n<h2>MOUNTAIN MAYHEM</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>The Snowdonia National Park Authority is trialling a pre-booking system at the popular Pen-y-Pass car park, for weekends and bank holidays, during the remainder of the holiday season.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>A villager said: &#8220;We have never seen anything like it. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;The crowds have been unbelievable, and some completely anti-social and who would be better suited in Magaluf.‚Äù¬†</p>\n\n\n\n<p>In July <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12224753/police-turn-away-sixty-cars-snowdon-chaos/\">police turned away 60 cars from the bottom of Snowdon after 600 vehicles caused chaos</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Drivers were warned their cars would be towed if they parked illegally and blocked the road in the Welsh national park.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Signs were installed and cones laid out to discourage motorists from leaving the vehicles on the highway.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row moment man is sent somersaulting over hedge by &#039;road rage driver&#039;\t\t\t</span>\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail__item-content -->\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-gradient-light\">\n\n\t</div>\n\t<a .swiper-wrapper -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-button-prev theme__background-color-rgba-80\"></div>\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-button-next theme__background-color-rgba-80\"></div>\n\n\t\t\t\t</div><!-- .swiper-container -->\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail .{rail} .swiper-video-rail .{theme-slug} -->\n\n\t\t</div><!-- .col .sun-col-6 -->\n\t</div><!-- .sun-row .{row} .rail-video-index-->\n\t</div> <!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>Snowdonia National Park officially reopened on July 6 after closing at the start of the lockdown in March.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But the chaos around England and Wales&#8217; highest peak caused the park to ban parking at Pen-y-Pass at weekends.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489996\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000594967785.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489996\" width=\"960\" Brightcove Player -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div style=\"display: block; position: relative; min-width: 0px; max-width: 640px;\">\n\t\t\t\t<div style=\"padding-top: 56%; -->\n\n\t\t\n\n\n<div></div>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 23:32:37 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/26a0.png","linkMd5":"904861c01e565d190d9a863164a28637","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn13@2020_1/2020/08/25/00-41-46-615_8c2ee998bba5b6ed.webp","destWidth":72,"destHeight":72,"sourceBytes":595,"destBytes":1080,"author":"Ellie Cambridge","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/26a0.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn13@2020_1/2020/08/25/00-41-46-615_8c2ee998bba5b6ed.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000565683263.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn16@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-42-04-593_0eccaaec9e0aeef3.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000594967331.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn87@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-42-05-397_9c3127d43783b4e8.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000594967785.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn34@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-41-56-044_d0088803611dcfdf.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316106180},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:41:46","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:41:46","title":"Banning anthems from the Last Night of the Proms will only manipulate history and create confusion","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12489337/banning-anthems-proms-manipulates-history/","description":"<p><strong>NO song should be banned. Doing so only manipulates history and creates confusion.</strong></p> \n<p>The BBC was last night facing a storm of anger over a proposal to drop Rule, Britannia! and Land Of Hope And Glory from the Last Night of the Proms.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12489510\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000246710375.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489510\" width=\"960\" height=\"639\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  PA:Press Association\n </figcredit>\n</figure>We shouldn‚Äôt be bothering ourselves about whether those songs should now be removed, says Geoff Palmer[/caption] \n<p>Finnish conductor Dalia Stasevska, 35, is said to be keen to modernise the show and cut its patriotic elements, while critics accuse the Beeb of <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/uknews/12476359/rule-britannia-land-hope-glory-black-lives-matter-bbc-proms/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">pandering to the woke cancel culture and of ignoring the history of the anthems.</a></p> \n<p>Both the PM and his culture secretary Oliver Dowden involved themselves in the row, with the latter saying he believed that Rule, Britannia! and Land Of Hope And Glory are ‚Äòhighlights‚Äô of the performance while adding: ‚ÄúConfident, forward-looking nations don‚Äôt erase their history, they add to it.‚Äù</p> \n<p>But then late in the day the BBC took the side of the woke cancel brigade in an extraordinary fudge.</p> \n<p>The orchestra will play the tunes of both songs ‚Äî but nobody will sing the all-important words. Usually there is at least a soloist, if not a full choir leading the audience, but of course this year the public seats in the hall will be empty because of the virus, and the voices on stage silenced.</p> \n<p>Now, the lyrics of both songs are pro-colonial. If you <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12486053/bbc-rule-britannia-land-of-hope-and-glory-proms-woke-blm/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">ban them from the Last Night of the Proms,</a> ending a tradition going back decades, what consequences will that have?</p> \n<p>Certainly, someone 100 years from now will say we shouldn‚Äôt have done that.</p> \n<p>It is the same argument for not taking down statues. If you remove statues because that person stands for something evil in their past, you are removing the deed too.</p> \n<p>Manipulating history only adds to mistrust among the black community.</p> \n<p>I would like to see the survey that says the public want these two songs taken out of the Proms programme, because it appears to me that the public hasn‚Äôt been consulted.</p> \n<p>Rule, Britannia! was written by Scottish poet James Thomson and he features on the famous Scott Monument in Edinburgh, near where I live.</p> \n<h2>‚ÄòWE SHOULDN‚ÄôT HIDE IT‚Äô</h2> \n<p>He is also commemorated in Westminster Abbey‚Äôs Poets‚Äô Corner, next to William Shakespeare.</p> \n<p>If we say we must remove his words from the Proms, do we then remove the memorials too?</p> \n<p>Rule, Britannia!, written and set to music in 1740, was mentioned in James Joyce‚Äôs novel, Ulysses. It is part of my history and my culture. If we take it away, we take away part of my culture.</p> \n<p>It‚Äôs a song about the power structure at the time, and the arrogance and hypocrisy of Britain vowing to ‚Äúnever be slaves‚Äù while at the same time owning and benefiting from about 800,000 black chattel slaves in the West Indies who were called ‚Äòproperty‚Äô.</p> \n<p>Of course, people are sensitive to its meaning, as well as Land Of Hope And Glory, the music of which was written by Edward Elgar.</p> \n<p>It doesn‚Äôt mean we should hide it.</p> \n<p>I personally don‚Äôt find the lyrics offensive because they are a true representation of the terrible truth at the time.</p> \n<p>If you take that away, then you are replacing history with a fairy story.</p> \n<p>There is also the possibility that it was written to show the evil of the time, rather than glorifying it.</p> \n<p>The objection is that Rule, Britannia! is used by flag-waving ‚Äúprommers‚Äù as a jubilant finale at the Proms.</p> \n<h2>‚ÄòJUBILANT FINALE‚Äô</h2> \n<p>It is used in the wrong context, and that is part of the ignorance of our society of our history.</p> \n<p>It‚Äôs the same with Amazing Grace, which was written by a slaver of black people and is sung as a religious anthem.</p> \n<p>Recently, it was proposed that we should ban Swing Low, Sweet Chariot at rugby matches due to its link to slavery. That came to nothing.</p> \n<p>Instead of banning such songs or stripping away their lyrics, we need to educate people on the history of slavery, starting with putting it on the history curriculum.</p> \n<p>From speaking to people about slavery, the one constant reaction is always: ‚ÄúWhy didn‚Äôt anyone tell us this before?‚Äù</p> \n<p>At the Proms, instead of taking the words away, we should put an explanation in the programme. We should tell people it‚Äôs about enslaving black people, making money from them, giving them a short life span and then compensating the slave owners when it was abolished because slaves were regarded as ‚Äòproperty‚Äô.</p> \n<p>If they want to sing it after reading that, then fine, go ahead and sing it. But I bet they won‚Äôt sing it as joyfully as they might have done before.</p> \n<p>When I worked in research, I once had a lovely technician who worked for me. She looked after me so well, and she went to the Proms.</p> \n<p>If she knew the history of those two songs, being my friend, I doubt she would have sung along.</p> \n<p>It wasn‚Äôt her fault that she didn‚Äôt know the history.</p> \n<p>Those songs didn‚Äôt have a place in the Proms in the first place, they are there because of people‚Äôs ignorance. I would challenge anyone to know their meanings and still sing them in a frivolous capacity.</p> \n<!--googleoff: all--> \n<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\"> \n <div \n       <div class=\"rail__item-content\"> \n        <h3 class=\"rail__item-headline theme__copy-color\"> THE SUN SAYS </h3> \n        <span class=\"rail__item-sub\"> Union militants see Covid crisis as perfect excuse to hold Govt to ransom </span> \n       </div>\n       <!-- .rail__item-content --> \n       <div class=\"rail__item-gradient-light\"> \n       </div> \n       <a class=\"rail__item swiper-slide\"> \n       <div class=\"rail__item-image\"> \n        <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12469984/rishi-sunak-tax-amazon-boss-jeff-bezos/\"> \n         <div class=\"delayed-image-load-landscape\" data-src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/CJ-COMP-TONY-PARSONS.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=300&amp;h=192&amp;crop=1\"></div> \n         <div   <!-- .rail__item-image --> \n       <div class=\"rail__item-content\"> \n        <h3 class=\"rail__item-headline theme__copy-color\"> TONY PARSONS </h3> \n        <span class=\"rail__item-sub\"> Rishi Sunak, don‚Äôt be a bozo and tax us - tax Amazon boss Jeff Bezos instead </span> \n       </div>\n       <!-- .rail__item-content --> \n       <div class=\"rail__item-gradient-light\"> \n       </div> \n       <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12469984/rishi-sunak-tax-amazon-boss-jeff-bezos/\" class=\"rail__item-anchor\"></a> \n      </div>\n      <!-- .rail__item .swiper-slide --> \n     </div>\n     <!-- .swiper-wrapper --> \n     <div class=\"swiper-button-prev theme__background-color-rgba-80\"></div> \n     <div class=\"swiper-button-next theme__background-color-rgba-80\"></div> \n    </div>\n    <!-- .swiper-container --> \n   </div>\n   <!-- .rail .{rail} .swiper-video-rail .{theme-slug} --> \n  </div>\n  <!-- .col .sun-col-6 --> \n </div>\n <!-- .sun-row .{row} .rail-video-index--> \n</div> \n<!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} --> \n<!--googleon: all--> \n<p>But we shouldn‚Äôt be bothering ourselves about whether those songs should now be removed.</p> \n<p>What we should be bothering ourselves about is increasing the representation of black people who are the descendants of slaves. </p> \n<p>We should be concerning ourselves about making sure black people from the Windrush generation get compensation. And we should also be ensuring ourselves that every child is taught the history of slavery so that they can make their own minds up about whether to sing songs like these.</p> \n<ul>\n <li><strong>Sir Geoff Palmer OBE is a Professor Emeritus in the School of Life Sciences at Heriot-Watt University in Edinburgh, Scotland, a human rights activist ‚Äì and a huge fan of classical music.</strong></li>\n</ul> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12489514\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000534817854.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489514\" width=\"960\" height=\"604\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Mark Allan\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Finnish conductor Dalia Stasevska is said to be keen to modernise the show and cut its patriotic elements[/caption] \n<!-- Start of Brightcove Player --> \n<div style=\"display: block; position: relative; min-width: 0px; max-width: 640px;\"> \n <div style=\"padding-top: 56%; \"> \n  <video data-video-id=\"6184087313001\" data-account=\"5067014667001\" data-player=\"default\" data-usage=\"cms:wordpress:5.4.2:1.7.0:javascript\" data-embed=\"default\" class=\"video-js\" controls=\"\" style=\"width: 100%; height: 100%; position: absolute; top: 0; bottom: 0; right: 0; left: 0;\"> \n  </video> \n  <script src=\"https://players.brightcove.net/5067014667001/default_default/index.min.js\"></script> \n </div> \n</div> \n<!-- End of Brightcove Player --> \n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" /> \n<p><strong>GOT a story? inside","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12489063/jacob-blakes-fiancee-shot-kids-screaming-wisconsin/","description":"<p>JACOB &#8220;Jake&#8221; Blake‚Äôs partner says he was shot seven times by a while cop while their kids &#8220;screamed&#8221; in back of the car. </p>\n<p>His fianc√©e, <a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/news/1360763/who-is-jacob-blakes-fiancee-laquisha-booker/\">Laquisha Booker</a>, has spoken out after <a href=\"http://the-sun.com/who/jacob-blake\">Blake</a>, 29, was shot in front of their kids by <a href=\"http://the-sun.com/topic/police\">police</a> in¬†Kenosha, <a href=\"http://the-sun.com/where/Wisconsin\">Wisconsin</a> on Sunday. </p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12489061\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 460px\"><img break up a domestic dispute and was unarmed [/caption]</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12489062\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 679px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603834933.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=669\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489062\" width=\"669\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Universal News &#38; Sport (Europe)</figcredit></figure>The white cop shot Blake at point blank range[/caption]</p>\n<p>A video circulating on social media shows&#160;<a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/news/1361459/jacob-blake-kenosh-wisconsin-police-shooting-riots/\">him walking towards a car</a>&#160;followed by two officers and one of them shooting him as he opens the car door.</p>\n<p>Booker told <a href=\"https://www.tmj4.com/news/local-news/man-injured-after-officer-involved-shooting-in-kenosha\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">WTMJ</a> that she and Jacob have three children together ‚Äì¬†and they were all in the back of the truck at the time. </p>\n<p>&#8220;That man just literally grabbed him by his shirt and looked the other way and was just shooting him,&#8221; Booker said. </p>\n<p>&#8220;With the kids in the back screaming. Screaming.&#8221;</p>\n<p>&#8220;That don&#8217;t make sense that you treat somebody like that, who&#8217;s not armed. He ain&#8217;t throw no punch or nothing.&#8221;</p>\n<p>Meanwhile, Blake&#8217;s <a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/news/1359324/jake-blake-family-shooting-police-kenosha-wisconsin/\">family have also spoken out</a> after he was rushed to hospital and underwent an operation. </p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12485090\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/665a38c5-1a31-4506-b40b-0c42e6907a12.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12485090\" [/caption]</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12485096\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/11490891-5b69-46cc-bf84-0cc3835dca4b.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12485096\" make sense&#8217; [/caption]</p>\n<p>Demonstrations erupted after&#160;<a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/who/jacob-blake/\">Blake</a>&#8216;s three son&#8217;s saw their dad being shot as police responded to a domestic dispute he wasn&#8217;t involved in.</p>\n<p>Kenosha County declared a state of emergency curfew from 8pm tonight and Governor Tony Evers called in the National Guard.</p>\n<p>&#8220;We will not excuse the actions of the Kenosha Police department, but his mother asks everyone to please remain peaceful,&#8221; one family member tweeted.</p>\n<p>The Wisconsin Department of Justice Division of Criminal Investigation (DCI) confirmed the incident is being investigated in a press release.</p>\n<p>The officers involved have all been place on administrative leave.</p>\n<p>Blake came out of surgery this morning after being rushed to Froedtert Hospital in Milwaukee, where he remains in ICU.</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12485097\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 539px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603836215.png?strip=all&#38;w=529\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone seen walking away from police officers in the video[/caption]</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12485098\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 545px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603836211.png?strip=all&#38;w=535\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12485098\" of Jacob Blake as he was getting into an SUV[/caption]</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_undefined\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 10px\"><a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/news/1359955/cop-knocked-out-brick-kenosha-protest-jacob-blake/#\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603838706-1.jpg\" alt=\"Blake was then shot repeatedly in front of his three sons \" class=\"alignnone\" /></a><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Blake with his kids</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure></p>\n<p>In an emotional video posted to his Instagram Stories, his dad Jacob Blake (Sr) said nothing &#8220;[justifies] shooting my son in the back eight times&#8221; as&#160;<a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/news/1359324/jake-blake-family-shooting-police-kenosha-wisconsin/\">other family members spoke out</a>.</p>\n<p>Blake&#8217;s loved family have retained a civil rights lawyer Ben Crump, who said Blake was helping to deescalate a domestic incident when police drew their weapons and tasered him.</p>\n<p>Crump told The Sun as Blake was walking away to check on his children when police fired their weapons several times into his back at point blank range ‚Äì&#160;in front of his kids.</p>\n<p>&#8220;His three sons witnessed their father collapse after being riddled with bullets,&#8221; Crump said in an email.</p>\n<p>&#8220;Their irresponsible, reckless, and inhumane actions nearly cost the life of a man who was simply trying to do the right thing by intervening in a domestic incident.</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12485100\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 546px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603836243.png?strip=all&#38;w=536\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12485100\" width=\"536\" height=\"724\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Raysean White via TMX.news</figcredit></figure>Blake tried to get into a grey SUV where his sons were [/caption]</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12485101\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603801528-1.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12485101\" width=\"960\" height=\"550\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>AP:Associated Press</figcredit></figure>Angry crowds took to the streets of Kenosha to protest his shooting[/caption]</p>\n<p>&#8220;It‚Äôs a miracle he‚Äôs still alive,&#8221; Crump added, vowing to seek justice for the Blake family</p>\n<p>&#8220;How many of these tragic &#8216;while Black&#8217; tragedies will it take until the racial profiling and undervaluing of Black lives by the police finally stops?&#8221; Crump concluded.</p>\n<p>A state of emergency was declared in Kenosha County after Blake was gunned down on Sunday evening.</p>\n<p>Shocking footage has emerged showing <a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/news/1359955/cop-knocked-out-brick-kenosha-protest-jacob-blake/\">a cop being hit in the temple by a projectile</a>, which was reportedly a brick.</p>\n<p>A citywide curfew was issued until 7am on Monday after Blake&#8217;s shooting triggered mass outrage.</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12485390\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 580px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/5f3fa5d2-71d6-4475-988e-ae810cb3b136.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=570\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12485390\" back[/caption]</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12485391\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img width=\"960\" height=\"479\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Twitter</figcredit></figure>Blake&#8217;s mother has asked people to remain peaceful as the city erupted in riots[/caption]</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/news/1358071/wisconsin-white-police-shoot-black-unarmed-man-kids/\">A video showed&#160;</a>the 29-year-old dad being shot by a cop at least seven times on 40th Street, while his three sons waited in a grey SUV.</p>\n<p>Last night, hoards of of protesters arrived at the scene of the shooting before before descending on the Kenosha&#160;<a href=\"http://the-sun.com/topic/\">police</a>&#160;station.</p>\n<p>Riot cops reportedly held plastic shields and batons to move people out of the way and used pepper balls as SWAT vehicles remained on the streets, reported&#160;<a href=\"https://abc7chicago.com/protests-erupt-in-kenosha-after-police-caught-on-video-shooting-unarmed-black-man/6385647/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">KABC-TV.</a></p>\n<p>A&#160;<a href=\"https://twitter.com/lauren_linder/status/1297741712471871491?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">TMJ4-TV reporter</a>&#160;posted that local cops later deployed tear gas.</p>\n<p>Another disturbing&#160;<a href=\"https://twitter.com/BotchlaUS/status/1297727292324683776\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Twitter</a>&#160;recording shows protesters hurling molotov cocktails and bricks at cops standing near a patrol car as one officer was struck down by a flying calling himself a &#8220;d***head&#8221; in a video on Instagram.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/12468426/katie-prices-son-harvey-brave-mum-stop-crying-get-better/\">Katie</a> filmed Harvey enjoying a bit of banter with his mum as she rested in bed following an operation to fix both of her feet.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489386\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 533px\"><img swearing</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/12468426/katie-prices-son-harvey-brave-mum-stop-crying-get-better/\">Harvey</a>, 18, wanted to cheer her up and asked for cuddles, saying: &#8220;It&#8217;s mummy&#8217;s day!&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Katie replied: &#8220;Did you say you&#8217;re going in mummy&#8217;s bed to drive mummy nuts? You&#8217;re such a little charmer Price, aren&#8217;t you? You absolute&#8230;&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But Harvey stole her punchline, blurting out: &#8220;D******d!&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Katie later filmed her eldest son on her Instagram Story and he swore again after she refused to let him watch cartoons in her room.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489391\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 542px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/ecb10aea-59db-48a8-a1ca-8abe860efdd1.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=532\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489391\" width=\"532\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Harvey brings his mum Ribena and water</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>He told her to &#8220;shut the hell up&#8221; after she said: &#8220;Harv, what are you doing? I tell you what, if you think you&#8217;re getting in my bed&#8230;. what are you watching?&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The teenager replied with a smile: &#8220;F*****g Barney. Bloody Barney.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And his mum scolded him, saying: &#8220;Harvey you can&#8217;t swear!&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Katie also revealed she is sending Harvey back to school next week for the first time since the coronavirus pandemic.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489407\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 560px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/8100d04d-4d69-4fc2-9caf-e37fa07f4b15.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=550\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489407\" width=\"550\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">The teenager wanted to watch cartoons in his mum&#8217;s room</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>He looked so excited, throwing his hands in the air, saying: &#8220;Oh my god, yes mummy! Love it!&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The teen, who has Prader-Willi syndrome, was taken out of his residential carehome when lockdown was announced and went back to live with Katie full time.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And he is helping to take care of his mum following her accident in Turkey, bringing her drinks and snacks in bed.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489413\" class=\"wp-caption \n<p>If you have deep dreams of change sleeping in your heart, this is the moment to act thanks to a try-anything moon.</p> \n<p>Aries‚Äô ability to bounce back stronger takes you close to the top of \n<p><strong>April 21 to May 21</strong></p> \n<p>A makeover moon goes hand in hand with a passion project.</p> \n<p>Aim high in love and life generally, as you can achieve so much more than you might expect.</p> \n<p>You will switch to a fast-track path by tonight! Saturn smoothes a study path, meanwhile, helping you get obstacles into focus and deal with them.</p> \n<h3><img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/264a.png\" alt=\"‚ôä\" class=\"wp-smiley\" style=\"height: 1em; max-height: 1em;\" /> GEMINI</h3> \n<p><strong>May 22 to June 21</strong></p> \n<p>This is not your day for a ‚Äúgood enough‚Äù solution. But at the same time, your chart is intensely emotional.</p> \n<p>With Venus in your sign, you are ready to say some special love words or set in motion a change of status.</p> \n<p>A work or life contract might have faded but you can bring it back.</p> \n<h3><strong><img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/264c.png\" alt=\"‚ôå\" class=\"wp-smiley\" style=\"height: 1em; max-height: 1em;\" /> LEO</strong></h3> \n<p><strong>July 23 to August 23</strong></p> \n<p>Maybe you tend to hold back your best ideas at work but a new colleague can really make them fly.</p> \n<p>So do try sharing, a little at a time. Your passion profile is packed with mystery and a slow, sensual treasure hunt intrigues a partner.</p> \n<p>Single? A new solo business or music act can be your passport to love happiness.</p> \n<h3><strong><img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/264d.png\" alt=\"‚ôç\" class=\"wp-smiley\" style=\"height: 1em; max-height: 1em;\" /> VIRGO</strong></h3> \n<p><strong>August 24 to September 22</strong></p> \n<p>Tread carefully around feelings at home, as someone who seems super-confident might feel different inside.</p> \n<p>Make room for a creative scheme with a design twist that stretches your skills, as there is a passion introduction in this pipeline.</p> \n<p>In love? Be generous with your time.</p> \n<h3><strong><img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/264e.png\" alt=\"‚ôé\" class=\"wp-smiley\" style=\"height: 1em; max-height: 1em;\" /> LIBRA</strong></h3> \n<p><strong>September 23 to October 23</strong></p> \n<p>A contacts and communication moon is a positive pointer in your chart. Whatever you want or need to say can happen.</p> \n<p>Words might stray from a plan but will work if they are sincere.</p> \n<p>As Saturn shakes up your home life, a new address might be delayed when a building among trees joins your wish list.</p> \n<h3><strong><img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/264f.png\" alt=\"‚ôè\" class=\"wp-smiley\" style=\"height: 1em; max-height: 1em;\" /> SCORPIO</strong></h3> \n<p><strong>October 24 to November 22</strong></p> \n<p>Your chart is all about seeing true value and making this work for you.</p> \n<p>You know what you need and claim it for your own‚Äâ.‚Äâ.‚Äâ.‚Äâeven if not everyone understands.</p> \n<p>Saturn draws a line in a talking process, daring someone close to cross it. The X-factor is your shining energy and ability to adapt.</p> \n<p>Passion expects a lot but you give even more. Luck links three summer birthdays.</p> \n<h3><strong><img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/2651.png\" alt=\"‚ôë\" class=\"wp-smiley\" style=\"height: 1em; max-height: 1em;\" /> CAPRICORN</strong></h3> \n<p><strong>December 22 to January 20</strong></p> \n<p>There is a note of caution in your chart, so be careful not to reveal too much, especially in a work or cash situation.</p> \n<p>If facts aren‚Äôt quite right for sharing, let them simmer a little longer.</p> \n<p>In love terms, too, you are an enigma in all the luscious ways partners adore. 08:41:46","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:41:46","title":"EastEnders fans stunned as tough Shirley Carter actress Linda Henry breaks down in tears over missing her grandson","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/12489013/eastenders-shirley-carter-linda-henry-tears/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>EASTENDERS fans were left stunned this evening when Shirley Carter actress Linda Henry broke down in tears on tonight&#8217;s Secrets From The Square.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The 57-year-old actress is famed for playing the hardfaced, tough nut Walford resident &#8211; and viewers couldn&#8217;t believe how different she is in real life.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489038\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/linda2.png?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489038\" width=\"960\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Linda broke down in tears in tonight&#8217;s Secrets From The Square</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>As host<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/who/stacey-dooley/\"> Stacey Dooley</a> kicked off the episode, she asked Linda and her co-star <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/11620834/inside-eastenders-star-luisa-bradshaw-whites-colourful-home/\">Luisa Bradshaw-White</a> &#8211; who plays her onscreen sister Tina &#8211; how they had spent lockdown.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/10574406/eastenders-shirley-carter-two-roles-linda-henry/\">Linda </a>suddenly started weeping as she admitted that she&#8217;d been missing her grandson, with Luisa dropping another bombshell as she revealed that Linda cries &#8220;all the time&#8221;.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Stacey asked: &#8220;What have you been doing in lockdown?&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Linda replied: &#8220;I&#8217;ve just been at home, I live with my husband and my dog Johnny.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489051\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/linda3.png?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489051\" width=\"960\" height=\"725\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Linda was too choked up to speak</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489045\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000504040421-1.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489045\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>BBC</figcredit></figure>Linda plays hardfaced Shirley Carter[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Her voice then notably cracked as she continued: &#8220;And really wishing &#8211; my grandson‚Ä¶ I just really‚Ä¶&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>She then stopped talking as she started to cry, going on to tell Stacey that her grandson was two years old.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Luisa giggled: &#8220;She cries about everything.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;You do, you always cry &#8211; you&#8217;re so sensitive.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489044\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000551834643-1.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489044\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>BBC</figcredit></figure>Linda appeared on the show alongside onscreen sister Luisa [/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Linda continued to choke up at various points throughout the episode, and fans were shocked by the emotional display.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>One tweeted: &#8220;Obsessed with how Linda is basically the opposite of Shirley&#8221;.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>One more agreed: &#8220;Linda Henry is the absolute opposite of Shirley and I adore it.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>A third wrote: &#8220;The fact that Linda Henry is this sweet and sensitive is making 2020 ok&#8221;.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489065\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/linda-1.png?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489065\" width=\"960\" height=\"802\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Fans couldn&#8217;t believe what Linda is like in real life</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>Another was surprised by her physical transformation, writing: &#8220;I can‚Äôt believe that‚Äôs what Shirley looks like in real life! She‚Äôs even more amazing!&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Luisa even revealed that Linda cried when she found out what was in store for Shirley when <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/topic/eastenders/\">EastEnders </a>returns to our screens next month.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Linda said of her character: &#8220;The past comes back to bite Shirley on the bum.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489043\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000534843750.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489043\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>BBC</figcredit></figure>The star is one of Walford&#8217;s toughest characters[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Luisa added: &#8220;It&#8217;s a really exciting storyline, she [Linda] cried!&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Addressing her co-star directly she continued: &#8220;Because you do cry.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;She gets really emotional.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489066\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img 08:41:46","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:41:46","title":"Vegans ‚Äòhave the worst diets and are less likely to cook from scratch‚Äô","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12490146/vegans-worst-diets-cook-less-frm-scratch-study/","description":"<p>VEGANS have the worst diets, a study suggests.</p> \n<p>The more they avoided meat, butter, cheese and milk, the more processed foods they consumed.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12490189\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000551402805.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12490189\" width=\"960\" height=\"641\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Getty - Contributor\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Vegans have the worst diets as they eat more processed foods, a study suggests[/caption] \n<p>They are also less likely to cook from scratch.</p> \n<p>A poll found microwave meals, pastries, cakes, sugary drinks and cereals made up 39 per cent of a vegan‚Äôs diet.</p> \n<p>For veggies it was 37 per cent and 33 per cent for meat eaters.</p> \n<p>Previous studies linked processed food to heart disease and cancer.</p> \n<p>The team at Sorbonne University in Paris polled more than 21,000 adults.</p> \n<p>Researchers said processed foods included ‚Äòindustrial plant-based meat substitutes‚Äô ‚Äì such as veggie burgers ‚Äì made with flavouring agents, colourings and other chemicals.</p> \n<p>In a report on the findings they warned vegan and vegetarian diets may be much less healthy than consumers think ‚Äì especially as they are likely to lead to an increase in snacking.</p> \n<p>‚ÄòNot all vegetarian diets necessarily have health benefits,‚Äô they said.</p> \n<!--googleoff: all--> \n<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\"> return is compulsory.</p> \n<p>Travellers who arrive back in the UK from the Netherlands after August 15 have to self-isolate for 14 days under coronavirus safety measures.</p> \n<!--googleoff: all--> \n</div> \n<!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} --> \n<!--googleon: all--> \n<p>Tickets for the new rail service go on sale from September 1 and can be booked up to six months in advance.</p> \n<p>Eurostar said all bookings made from July 1 to December 31 are exchangeable for any dates of travel available at the time of purchase, with no exchange fee up to 14 days before departure.</p> \n<p>The company said its trains are deep cleaned before every journey and that a new seat map system will ensure passengers are kept at a safe distance apart.</p> \n<!-- Start of hope","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12488646/man-utd-mason-greenwood-euros/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>GARETH SOUTHGATE has been told he is about to welcome into his England dressing room ‚Äúa cold-hearted killer‚Äù.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/who/rio-ferdinand/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Rio Ferdinand</a> reckons there are few deadlier strikers around at the moment than Mason Greenwood.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12488777\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603843771.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12488777\" width=\"960\" England squad[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12488778\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000602676400.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12488778\" width=\"960\" height=\"638\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>PA:Press Association</figcredit></figure>Rio Ferdinand has backed Greenwood to shine for the Three Lions[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Manchester United‚Äôs teen sensation is expected to be handed his first England call-up on Tuesday when boss Southgate names his squad for next month‚Äôs Nations League clashes in Iceland and Denmark.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And former Three Lions and Red Devils star Ferdinand said: ‚ÄúMason is a cold-hearted killer, a great finisher.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>‚ÄúJust look at his videos and watch him from when he was a kid ‚Äî he‚Äôs not doing anything different now.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>‚ÄúHe‚Äôs just doing it on a different pitch and in a bigger stadium, with more people watching. He‚Äôs got all the same habits.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>‚ÄúHe‚Äôs a natural goalscorer who is going to score loads and loads of goals.‚Äù</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Greenwood, 18, burst on the scene at Old Trafford this season with 17 goals in all competitions.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He is now being widely tipped to keep his place in Southgate‚Äôs squad for the delayed Euro 2020 finals next summer.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Ex-defender Ferdinand, who is now a BT Sport pundit, won 81 caps for England from 1997 to 2011.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t<blockquote class=\"article__quote\">\n\t\t<div class=\"article__quote-copy theme__before-color theme__after-color\">\n\t\t\t<p>Could the Euros being delayed by a year actually work out for Mason? Probably, yeah.</p>\n\t\t\t\t<cite class=\"article__quote-credit theme__copy-color\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class=\"quote-credit\">Rio Ferdinand</span>\t\t\t\t</cite>\n\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t</blockquote>\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>He believes the Euros being put back a year due to the coronavirus crisis could end up doing <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/who/mason-greenwood/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Greenwood</a> ‚Äî and England ‚Äî &#160;a big favour.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And Ferdinand has no qualms about the red-hot Red Devil rookie‚Äôs tenders years.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He explained: ‚ÄúCould&#160;the Euros being delayed by a year actually work out for Mason? Probably, yeah.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>‚ÄúBut the great players, when they‚Äôre ready, they‚Äôre ready. You don‚Äôt care about their age.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>‚ÄúMichael Owen and Wayne Rooney are two great examples.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>‚ÄúOwen burst on to the scene at the 1998 World Cup and Mason could do the same, given the chance.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>‚ÄúI love him. He‚Äôs a great¬†talent and what I also love about him is his demeanour, his character.</p>\n\n\n\n<img alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone\" />\n\n\n\n<p>‚ÄúNo matter the stage, same face, same expression, same way he carries himself.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>‚ÄúHe knows he‚Äôs good enough. ‚ÄòJust give me the ball and I‚Äôll do it‚Äô.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>‚ÄúHe ain‚Äôt got all that stuff going on off the pitch. There are no airs and graces about him. There isn‚Äôt anything else he‚Äôs worried about.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>‚ÄúHe‚Äôs just worried about how good he can be as a footballer. Which is what I really love.‚Äù</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Bradford-born Greenwood came through United‚Äôs academy after being spotted at their development school in Halifax at the age of just six.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He gave a glimpse of what was to follow when he finished 2017-18 as top scorer &#160;in the Premier League North Under-18 division ‚Äî despite still being at school and eligible for U-16 level.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>That caught the attention of then-United boss Jose Mourinho, who selected the youngster for the club‚Äôs pre-season tour of the USA before rubber stamping his first professional contract a few months later.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And Greenwood has really started to flourish since <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/who/ole-gunnar-solskjaer/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Ole Gunnar Solskjaer</a> succeeded Mourinho at Old Trafford in December 2018.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The teenage prospect made his senior debut for the club in their thrilling Champions League last-16, <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/8578294/psg-1-man-utd-3-agg-3-3-marcus-rashford-var-penalty/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">second-leg salvo against Paris Saint-Germain</a> at the Parc des Princes in March last year.</p>\n\n\n\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n\n\n\n<h2><strong><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/12390714/man-utd-transfer-news-live-jadon-sancho-dembele-pogba/\">MAN UTD NEWS LIVE: Click here for the latest United news</a></strong></h2>\n\n\n\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n\n\n\n<p>Greenwood celebrated with Marcus Rashford after the fellow homegrown star‚Äôs last-gasp penalty&#160;sealed a 3-1 victory to overturn their 2-0 first-leg deficit and see them through.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>His Prem bow also came off the bench in their 2-0 defeat at Arsenal four days later.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And Greenwood was handed his first start in the final game of the season against Cardiff.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>After seeing his side finish the campaign sixth in the table ‚Äî a whopping 32 points behind champions and noisy neighbours City ‚Äî and with only one victory in their last nine matches in all competitions, Solskjaer needed to lift the gloom.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He also needed to instil some optimism at Old Trafford this season.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And, make no mistake, Greenwood‚Äôs emergence has helped do that.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The two-footed frontman may also have saved the Red Devils from having to fork out ¬£150m on a new striker.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Greenwood, it appears, is the real deal. And that can only be good news for his club and country.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12488853\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000475929716.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12488853\" width=\"960\" Paris[/caption]\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col sun-col-6\">\n\n\t\t\t<div class=\"rail__header\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<h3 class=\"rail__title theme__after-color\">Most read in Football</h3>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-pagination theme__swiper-pagination\"></div>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-wrapper\">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\n<div class=\"rail__item swiper-slide\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"rail__item-image\">\n\t\t\t<a
